blocks.name: find
blocks.content: The Principle of Finite Induction (mathematical induction). Corollary 7.31 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 43. The simpler hypothesis shown here was suggested in an email from "Colin" on 1-Oct-2001. The hypothesis states that ` A ` is a set of natural numbers, zero belongs to ` A ` , and given any member of ` A ` the member's successor also belongs to ` A ` . The conclusion is that every natural number is in ` A ` . (Contributed by NM, 22-Feb-2004.) (Proof shortened by Andrew Salmon, 27-Aug-2011.)
blocks.origin:
thm find(setvar s0, class c0) {
  |- wceq(c0, com)
  -| w3a(wss(c0, com), wcel(emptycls, c0), wral(s0, c0, wcel(csuc(cv(s0)), c0)))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
} = {
  eqssi(c0, com)
  simp1i(wss(c0, com), wcel(emptycls, c0), wral(s0, c0, wcel(csuc(cv(s0)), c0)))
  ax-mp(wss(com, c0), wa(wcel(emptycls, c0), wral(s0, com, wi(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(csuc(cv(s0)), c0)))))
  ax-mp(wa(wcel(emptycls, c0), wral(s0, com, wi(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(csuc(cv(s0)), c0)))), wa(wcel(emptycls, c0), wral(s0, c0, wcel(csuc(cv(s0)), c0))))
  ax-mp(wa(wcel(emptycls, c0), wral(s0, c0, wcel(csuc(cv(s0)), c0))), w3a(wss(c0, com), wcel(emptycls, c0), wral(s0, c0, wcel(csuc(cv(s0)), c0))))
  3simpc(wss(c0, com), wcel(emptycls, c0), wral(s0, c0, wcel(csuc(cv(s0)), c0)))
  anim2i(wcel(emptycls, c0), wral(s0, c0, wcel(csuc(cv(s0)), c0)), wral(s0, com, wi(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(csuc(cv(s0)), c0))))
  sylbi(wral(s0, c0, wcel(csuc(cv(s0)), c0)), wral(s0, com, wi(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(csuc(cv(s0)), c0))), wal(s0, wi(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(csuc(cv(s0)), c0))))
  df-ral(s0, c0, wcel(csuc(cv(s0)), c0))
  alral(s0, com, wi(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(csuc(cv(s0)), c0)))
  peano5(s0, c0)
}

thm find(setvar s0, class c0) {
  ⊢ c0 = _om
  ⊣ (c0 ⊆ _om ∧ ∅ ∈ c0 ∧ ∀(s0 ∈ c0, suc(s0)∈ c0))
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
} = {
  eqssi(c0, com)
  simp1i(c0 ⊆ _om, ∅ ∈ c0, ∀(s0 ∈ c0, suc(s0)∈ c0))
  ax-mp(_om ⊆ c0, (∅ ∈ c0 ∧ ∀(s0 ∈ _om,(s0 ∈ c0 → suc(s0)∈ c0))))
  ax-mp((∅ ∈ c0 ∧ ∀(s0 ∈ _om,(s0 ∈ c0 → suc(s0)∈ c0))), (∅ ∈ c0 ∧ ∀(s0 ∈ c0, suc(s0)∈ c0)))
  ax-mp((∅ ∈ c0 ∧ ∀(s0 ∈ c0, suc(s0)∈ c0)), (c0 ⊆ _om ∧ ∅ ∈ c0 ∧ ∀(s0 ∈ c0, suc(s0)∈ c0)))
  3simpc(c0 ⊆ _om, ∅ ∈ c0, ∀(s0 ∈ c0, suc(s0)∈ c0))
  anim2i(∅ ∈ c0, ∀(s0 ∈ c0, suc(s0)∈ c0), ∀(s0 ∈ _om,(s0 ∈ c0 → suc(s0)∈ c0)))
  sylbi(∀(s0 ∈ c0, suc(s0)∈ c0), ∀(s0 ∈ _om,(s0 ∈ c0 → suc(s0)∈ c0)), ∀(s0,(s0 ∈ c0 → suc(s0)∈ c0)))
  df-ral(s0, c0, suc(s0)∈ c0)
  alral(s0, com, (s0 ∈ c0 → suc(s0)∈ c0))
  peano5(s0, c0)
}

blocks.name: finds
blocks.content: Principle of Finite Induction (inference schema), using implicit substitutions. The first four hypotheses establish the substitutions we need. The last two are the basis and the induction step. Theorem Schema 22 of [Suppes] p. 136. This is Metamath 100 proof #74. (Contributed by NM, 14-Apr-1995.)

thm finds(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2, wff w3, wff w4) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, com), w0)
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), emptycls), wb(w1, w2))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wb(w1, w3))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), csuc(cv(s1))), wb(w1, w4))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wb(w1, w0))
  -| w2
  -| wi(wcel(cv(s1), com), wi(w3, w4))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
  -| diffsw(s0, w2)
  -| diffsw(s0, w3)
  -| diffsw(s0, w4)
  -| diffsw(s1, w1)
} = {
  mpbid(wcel(c0, com), w0, wcel(c0, cab(s0, w1)))
  sseli(c0, com, cab(s0, w1))
  mp2an(wss(com, cab(s0, w1)), wcel(emptycls, cab(s0, w1)), wral(s1, com, wi(wcel(cv(s1), cab(s0, w1)), wcel(csuc(cv(s1)), cab(s0, w1)))))
  mpbir(wcel(emptycls, cab(s0, w1)), w2)
  elab(s0, emptycls, w1, w2)
  0ex()
  rgen(s1, com, wi(wcel(cv(s1), cab(s0, w1)), wcel(csuc(cv(s1)), cab(s0, w1))))
  3imtr4g(wcel(cv(s1), com), wcel(cv(s1), cab(s0, w1)), wcel(csuc(cv(s1)), cab(s0, w1)), w3, w4)
  elab(s0, cv(s1), w1, w3)
  elab(s0, csuc(cv(s1)), w1, w4)
  sucex(cv(s1))
  vex(s1)
  peano5(s1, cab(s0, w1))
  elabg(s0, c0, com, w1, w0)
  diff.emptycls.s(s0)
  diff.csuc.s(s0, cv(s1))
  diff.cv.s(s0, s1)
  diff.cab.s(s1, s0, w1)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
}

thm finds(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2, wff w3, wff w4) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ _om → w0)
  ⊣ (s0 = ∅ →(w1 ↔ w2))
  ⊣ (s0 = s1 →(w1 ↔ w3))
  ⊣ (s0 = suc(s1)→(w1 ↔ w4))
  ⊣ (s0 = c0 →(w1 ↔ w0))
  ⊣ w2
  ⊣ (s1 ∈ _om →(w3 → w4))
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, w0)
  ⊣ d(s0, w2)
  ⊣ d(s0, w3)
  ⊣ d(s0, w4)
  ⊣ d(s1, w1)
} = {
  mpbid(c0 ∈ _om, w0, c0 ∈ { s0 | w1 })
  sseli(c0, com, { s0 | w1 })
  mp2an(_om ⊆ { s0 | w1 }, ∅ ∈ { s0 | w1 }, ∀(s1 ∈ _om,(s1 ∈ { s0 | w1 } → suc(s1)∈ { s0 | w1 })))
  mpbir(∅ ∈ { s0 | w1 }, w2)
  elab(s0, emptycls, w1, w2)
  0ex()
  rgen(s1, com, (s1 ∈ { s0 | w1 } → suc(s1)∈ { s0 | w1 }))
  3imtr4g(s1 ∈ _om, s1 ∈ { s0 | w1 }, suc(s1)∈ { s0 | w1 }, w3, w4)
  elab(s0, s1, w1, w3)
  elab(s0, suc(s1), w1, w4)
  sucex(s1)
  vex(s1)
  peano5(s1, { s0 | w1 })
  elabg(s0, c0, com, w1, w0)
  diff.emptycls.s(s0)
  diff.csuc.s(s0, s1)
  diff.cv.s(s0, s1)
  diff.cab.s(s1, s0, w1)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
}

blocks.name: findsg
blocks.content: Principle of Finite Induction (inference schema), using implicit substitutions. The first four hypotheses establish the substitutions we need. The last two are the basis and the induction step. The basis of this version is an arbitrary natural number ` B ` instead of zero. (Contributed by NM, 16-Sep-1995.)

thm findsg(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2, wff w3, wff w4) {
  |- wi(wa(wa(wcel(c0, com), wcel(c1, com)), wss(c1, c0)), w0)
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), c1), wb(w1, w2))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wb(w1, w3))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), csuc(cv(s1))), wb(w1, w4))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wb(w1, w0))
  -| wi(wcel(c1, com), w2)
  -| wi(wa(wa(wcel(cv(s1), com), wcel(c1, com)), wss(c1, cv(s1))), wi(w3, w4))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
  -| diffsw(s0, w2)
  -| diffsw(s0, w3)
  -| diffsw(s0, w4)
  -| diffsw(s1, w1)
} = {
  imp31(wcel(c0, com), wcel(c1, com), wss(c1, c0), w0)
  finds(s0, s1, c0, wi(wcel(c1, com), wi(wss(c1, c0), w0)), wi(wcel(c1, com), wi(wss(c1, cv(s0)), w1)), wi(wcel(c1, com), wi(wss(c1, emptycls), w2)), wi(wcel(c1, com), wi(wss(c1, cv(s1)), w3)), wi(wcel(c1, com), wi(wss(c1, csuc(cv(s1))), w4)))
  imbi2d(wceq(cv(s0), emptycls), wcel(c1, com), wi(wss(c1, cv(s0)), w1), wi(wss(c1, emptycls), w2))
  pm2.61ian(wceq(cv(s0), emptycls), wb(wi(wss(c1, cv(s0)), w1), wi(wss(c1, emptycls), w2)), wceq(c1, emptycls))
  imbi12d(wa(wceq(c1, emptycls), wceq(cv(s0), emptycls)), wss(c1, cv(s0)), w1, wss(c1, emptycls), w2)
  adantl(wceq(c1, emptycls), wceq(cv(s0), emptycls), wb(wss(c1, cv(s0)), wss(c1, emptycls)))
  imp(wceq(c1, emptycls), wceq(cv(s0), emptycls), wb(w1, w2))
  syl6bir(wceq(c1, emptycls), wceq(cv(s0), emptycls), wb(w1, w2), wceq(cv(s0), c1))
  eqeq2(c1, emptycls, cv(s0))
  sylan9bbr(wn(wceq(c1, emptycls)), wceq(cv(s0), emptycls), wi(wss(c1, cv(s0)), w1), wi(wss(c1, emptycls), w2), wi(wss(c1, emptycls), w1))
  imbi1d(wceq(cv(s0), emptycls), wss(c1, cv(s0)), w1, wss(c1, emptycls))
  sseq2(cv(s0), emptycls, c1)
  pm5.74d(wn(wceq(c1, emptycls)), wss(c1, emptycls), w1, w2)
  pm2.21d(wn(wceq(c1, emptycls)), wss(c1, emptycls), wb(w1, w2))
  con3i(wceq(c1, emptycls), wss(c1, emptycls))
  ss0(c1)
  imbi2d(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wcel(c1, com), wi(wss(c1, cv(s0)), w1), wi(wss(c1, cv(s1)), w3))
  imbi12d(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wss(c1, cv(s0)), w1, wss(c1, cv(s1)), w3)
  sseq2(cv(s0), cv(s1), c1)
  imbi2d(wceq(cv(s0), csuc(cv(s1))), wcel(c1, com), wi(wss(c1, cv(s0)), w1), wi(wss(c1, csuc(cv(s1))), w4))
  imbi12d(wceq(cv(s0), csuc(cv(s1))), wss(c1, cv(s0)), w1, wss(c1, csuc(cv(s1))), w4)
  sseq2(cv(s0), csuc(cv(s1)), c1)
  imbi2d(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wcel(c1, com), wi(wss(c1, cv(s0)), w1), wi(wss(c1, c0), w0))
  imbi12d(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wss(c1, cv(s0)), w1, wss(c1, c0), w0)
  sseq2(cv(s0), c0, c1)
  a1d(wcel(c1, com), wss(c1, emptycls), w2)
  a2d(wcel(cv(s1), com), wcel(c1, com), wi(wss(c1, cv(s1)), w3), wi(wss(c1, csuc(cv(s1))), w4))
  ex(wcel(cv(s1), com), wcel(c1, com), wi(wi(wss(c1, cv(s1)), w3), wi(wss(c1, csuc(cv(s1))), w4)))
  pm2.61d(wa(wcel(cv(s1), com), wcel(c1, com)), wi(wi(wss(c1, cv(s1)), w3), wi(wss(c1, csuc(cv(s1))), w4)), wi(wss(c1, csuc(cv(s1))), wceq(c1, csuc(cv(s1)))))
  adantl(wcel(cv(s1), com), wcel(c1, com), wi(wi(wss(c1, csuc(cv(s1))), wceq(c1, csuc(cv(s1)))), wi(wi(wss(c1, cv(s1)), w3), wi(wss(c1, csuc(cv(s1))), w4))))
  com4r(wcel(c1, com), wi(wss(c1, csuc(cv(s1))), wceq(c1, csuc(cv(s1)))), wi(wss(c1, cv(s1)), w3), wss(c1, csuc(cv(s1))), w4)
  a1d(wi(wss(c1, csuc(cv(s1))), wceq(c1, csuc(cv(s1)))), wi(wss(c1, cv(s1)), w3), wi(wss(c1, csuc(cv(s1))), wi(wcel(c1, com), w4)))
  imim2i(wss(c1, csuc(cv(s1))), wceq(c1, csuc(cv(s1))), wi(wcel(c1, com), w4))
  eqcoms(c1, csuc(cv(s1)), wi(wcel(c1, com), w4))
  sylbi(wceq(csuc(cv(s1)), c1), wi(wcel(c1, com), w4), wex(s0, wa(wceq(cv(s0), csuc(cv(s1))), wceq(cv(s0), c1))))
  eqvinc(s0, csuc(cv(s1)), c1)
  sucex(cv(s1))
  vex(s1)
  exlimiv(s0, wa(wceq(cv(s0), csuc(cv(s1))), wceq(cv(s0), c1)), wi(wcel(c1, com), w4))
  sylan9r(wceq(cv(s0), csuc(cv(s1))), wceq(cv(s0), c1), wcel(c1, com), w4, w1)
  syl5ibr(wceq(cv(s0), c1), wcel(c1, com), w1, w2)
  biimpd(wceq(cv(s0), csuc(cv(s1))), w1, w4)
  syl5bir(wa(wcel(cv(s1), com), wcel(c1, com)), wn(wi(wss(c1, csuc(cv(s1))), wceq(c1, csuc(cv(s1))))), wi(wi(wss(c1, cv(s1)), w3), wi(wss(c1, csuc(cv(s1))), w4)), wa(wss(c1, csuc(cv(s1))), wne(c1, csuc(cv(s1)))))
  bitri(wa(wss(c1, csuc(cv(s1))), wne(c1, csuc(cv(s1)))), wn(wi(wss(c1, csuc(cv(s1))), wceq(c1, csuc(cv(s1))))), wa(wss(c1, csuc(cv(s1))), wn(wceq(c1, csuc(cv(s1))))))
  anbi2i(wss(c1, csuc(cv(s1))), wne(c1, csuc(cv(s1))), wn(wceq(c1, csuc(cv(s1)))))
  df-ne(c1, csuc(cv(s1)))
  annim(wss(c1, csuc(cv(s1))), wceq(c1, csuc(cv(s1))))
  sylbird(wa(wcel(cv(s1), com), wcel(c1, com)), wa(wss(c1, csuc(cv(s1))), wne(c1, csuc(cv(s1)))), wi(wi(wss(c1, cv(s1)), w3), wi(wss(c1, csuc(cv(s1))), w4)), wss(c1, cv(s1)))
  syl2anr(wcel(cv(s1), com), wcel(c1, com), wb(wss(c1, cv(s1)), wa(wss(c1, csuc(cv(s1))), wne(c1, csuc(cv(s1))))), wcel(c1, con0), wcel(cv(s1), con0))
  nnon(c1)
  nnon(cv(s1))
  bitrd(wa(wcel(c1, con0), wcel(cv(s1), con0)), wss(c1, cv(s1)), wa(wss(c1, csuc(cv(s1))), wne(c1, csuc(cv(s1)))), wcel(c1, csuc(cv(s1))))
  onsssuc(c1, cv(s1))
  sylan2(wcel(c1, con0), wcel(cv(s1), con0), wb(wcel(c1, csuc(cv(s1))), wa(wss(c1, csuc(cv(s1))), wne(c1, csuc(cv(s1))))), wcel(csuc(cv(s1)), con0))
  suceloni(cv(s1))
  onelpss(c1, csuc(cv(s1)))
  com23(wa(wcel(cv(s1), com), wcel(c1, com)), wss(c1, cv(s1)), wi(wss(c1, cv(s1)), w3), wi(wss(c1, csuc(cv(s1))), w4))
  a2d(wa(wcel(cv(s1), com), wcel(c1, com)), wss(c1, cv(s1)), w3, wi(wss(c1, csuc(cv(s1))), w4))
  a1ddd(wa(wcel(cv(s1), com), wcel(c1, com)), wss(c1, cv(s1)), w3, wss(c1, csuc(cv(s1))), w4)
  ex(wa(wcel(cv(s1), com), wcel(c1, com)), wss(c1, cv(s1)), wi(w3, w4))
  diff.wi.s(s0, wcel(c1, com), wi(wss(c1, c0), w0))
  diff.wi.s(s0, wss(c1, c0), w0)
  diff.wss.s(s0, c1, c0)
  diff.wi.s(s0, wcel(c1, com), wi(wss(c1, emptycls), w2))
  diff.wi.s(s0, wss(c1, emptycls), w2)
  diff.wss.s(s0, c1, emptycls)
  diff.emptycls.s(s0)
  diff.wi.s(s0, wcel(c1, com), wi(wss(c1, cv(s1)), w3))
  diff.wi.s(s0, wss(c1, cv(s1)), w3)
  diff.wss.s(s0, c1, cv(s1))
  diff.wi.s(s0, wcel(c1, com), wi(wss(c1, csuc(cv(s1))), w4))
  diff.wi.s(s0, wss(c1, csuc(cv(s1))), w4)
  diff.wss.s(s0, c1, csuc(cv(s1)))
  diff.wi.s(s1, wcel(c1, com), wi(wss(c1, cv(s0)), w1))
  diff.wcel.s(s1, c1, com)
  diff.com.s(s1)
  diff.wi.s(s1, wss(c1, cv(s0)), w1)
  diff.wss.s(s1, c1, cv(s0))
  diff.cv.s(s1, s0)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
  diff.csuc.s(s0, cv(s1))
  diff.cv.s(s0, s1)
  diff.wi.s(s0, wcel(c1, com), w4)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c1, com)
  diff.com.s(s0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm findsg(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2, wff w3, wff w4) {
  ⊢ (((c0 ∈ _om ∧ c1 ∈ _om)∧ c1 ⊆ c0)→ w0)
  ⊣ (s0 = c1 →(w1 ↔ w2))
  ⊣ (s0 = s1 →(w1 ↔ w3))
  ⊣ (s0 = suc(s1)→(w1 ↔ w4))
  ⊣ (s0 = c0 →(w1 ↔ w0))
  ⊣ (c1 ∈ _om → w2)
  ⊣ (((s1 ∈ _om ∧ c1 ∈ _om)∧ c1 ⊆ s1)→(w3 → w4))
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c1)
  ⊣ d(s1, c1)
  ⊣ d(s0, w0)
  ⊣ d(s0, w2)
  ⊣ d(s0, w3)
  ⊣ d(s0, w4)
  ⊣ d(s1, w1)
} = {
  imp31(c0 ∈ _om, c1 ∈ _om, c1 ⊆ c0, w0)
  finds(s0, s1, c0, (c1 ∈ _om →(c1 ⊆ c0 → w0)), (c1 ∈ _om →(c1 ⊆ s0 → w1)), (c1 ∈ _om →(c1 ⊆ ∅ → w2)), (c1 ∈ _om →(c1 ⊆ s1 → w3)), (c1 ∈ _om →(c1 ⊆ suc(s1)→ w4)))
  imbi2d(s0 = ∅, c1 ∈ _om, (c1 ⊆ s0 → w1), (c1 ⊆ ∅ → w2))
  pm2.61ian(s0 = ∅, ((c1 ⊆ s0 → w1)↔(c1 ⊆ ∅ → w2)), c1 = ∅)
  imbi12d((c1 = ∅ ∧ s0 = ∅), c1 ⊆ s0, w1, c1 ⊆ ∅, w2)
  adantl(c1 = ∅, s0 = ∅, (c1 ⊆ s0 ↔ c1 ⊆ ∅))
  imp(c1 = ∅, s0 = ∅, (w1 ↔ w2))
  syl6bir(c1 = ∅, s0 = ∅, (w1 ↔ w2), s0 = c1)
  eqeq2(c1, emptycls, s0)
  sylan9bbr(¬ c1 = ∅, s0 = ∅, (c1 ⊆ s0 → w1), (c1 ⊆ ∅ → w2), (c1 ⊆ ∅ → w1))
  imbi1d(s0 = ∅, c1 ⊆ s0, w1, c1 ⊆ ∅)
  sseq2(s0, emptycls, c1)
  pm5.74d(¬ c1 = ∅, c1 ⊆ ∅, w1, w2)
  pm2.21d(¬ c1 = ∅, c1 ⊆ ∅, (w1 ↔ w2))
  con3i(c1 = ∅, c1 ⊆ ∅)
  ss0(c1)
  imbi2d(s0 = s1, c1 ∈ _om, (c1 ⊆ s0 → w1), (c1 ⊆ s1 → w3))
  imbi12d(s0 = s1, c1 ⊆ s0, w1, c1 ⊆ s1, w3)
  sseq2(s0, s1, c1)
  imbi2d(s0 = suc(s1), c1 ∈ _om, (c1 ⊆ s0 → w1), (c1 ⊆ suc(s1)→ w4))
  imbi12d(s0 = suc(s1), c1 ⊆ s0, w1, c1 ⊆ suc(s1), w4)

  imbi12d(s0 = c0, c1 ⊆ s0, w1, c1 ⊆ c0, w0)
  sseq2(s0, c0, c1)
  a1d(c1 ∈ _om, c1 ⊆ ∅, w2)
  a2d(s1 ∈ _om, c1 ∈ _om, (c1 ⊆ s1 → w3), (c1 ⊆ suc(s1)→ w4))
  ex(s1 ∈ _om, c1 ∈ _om, ((c1 ⊆ s1 → w3)→(c1 ⊆ suc(s1)→ w4)))
  pm2.61d((s1 ∈ _om ∧ c1 ∈ _om), ((c1 ⊆ s1 → w3)→(c1 ⊆ suc(s1)→ w4)), (c1 ⊆ suc(s1)→ c1 = suc(s1)))
  adantl(s1 ∈ _om, c1 ∈ _om, ((c1 ⊆ suc(s1)→ c1 = suc(s1))→((c1 ⊆ s1 → w3)→(c1 ⊆ suc(s1)→ w4))))
  com4r(c1 ∈ _om, (c1 ⊆ suc(s1)→ c1 = suc(s1)), (c1 ⊆ s1 → w3), c1 ⊆ suc(s1), w4)
  a1d((c1 ⊆ suc(s1)→ c1 = suc(s1)), (c1 ⊆ s1 → w3), (c1 ⊆ suc(s1)→(c1 ∈ _om → w4)))
  imim2i(c1 ⊆ suc(s1), c1 = suc(s1), (c1 ∈ _om → w4))
  eqcoms(c1, suc(s1), (c1 ∈ _om → w4))
  sylbi(suc(s1)= c1, (c1 ∈ _om → w4), ∃(s0,(s0 = suc(s1)∧ s0 = c1)))
  eqvinc(s0, suc(s1), c1)
  sucex(s1)
  vex(s1)
  exlimiv(s0, (s0 = suc(s1)∧ s0 = c1), (c1 ∈ _om → w4))
  sylan9r(s0 = suc(s1), s0 = c1, c1 ∈ _om, w4, w1)
  syl5ibr(s0 = c1, c1 ∈ _om, w1, w2)
  biimpd(s0 = suc(s1), w1, w4)
  syl5bir((s1 ∈ _om ∧ c1 ∈ _om), ¬(c1 ⊆ suc(s1)→ c1 = suc(s1)), ((c1 ⊆ s1 → w3)→(c1 ⊆ suc(s1)→ w4)), (c1 ⊆ suc(s1)∧ c1 ≠ suc(s1)))
  bitri((c1 ⊆ suc(s1)∧ c1 ≠ suc(s1)), ¬(c1 ⊆ suc(s1)→ c1 = suc(s1)), (c1 ⊆ suc(s1)∧ ¬ c1 = suc(s1)))
  anbi2i(c1 ⊆ suc(s1), c1 ≠ suc(s1), ¬ c1 = suc(s1))
  df-ne(c1, suc(s1))

  syl2anr(s1 ∈ _om, c1 ∈ _om, (c1 ⊆ s1 ↔(c1 ⊆ suc(s1)∧ c1 ≠ suc(s1))), c1 ∈ On, s1 ∈ On)
  nnon(c1)
  nnon(s1)
  bitrd((c1 ∈ On ∧ s1 ∈ On), c1 ⊆ s1, (c1 ⊆ suc(s1)∧ c1 ≠ suc(s1)), c1 ∈ suc(s1))
  onsssuc(c1, s1)

  suceloni(s1)

blocks.name: finds2
blocks.content: Principle of Finite Induction (inference schema), using implicit substitutions. The first three hypotheses establish the substitutions we need. The last two are the basis and the induction step. Theorem Schema 22 of [Suppes] p. 136. (Contributed by NM, 29-Nov-2002.)
blocks.origin:
thm finds2(setvar s0, setvar s1, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2, wff w3, wff w4) {
  |- wi(wcel(cv(s0), com), wi(w0, w1))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), emptycls), wb(w1, w2))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wb(w1, w3))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), csuc(cv(s1))), wb(w1, w4))
  -| wi(w0, w2)
  -| wi(wcel(cv(s1), com), wi(w0, wi(w3, w4)))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
  -| diffsw(s0, w2)
  -| diffsw(s0, w3)
  -| diffsw(s0, w4)
  -| diffsw(s1, w0)
  -| diffsw(s1, w1)
} = {
  sylib(wcel(cv(s0), com), wi(w0, w1), wcel(cv(s0), cab(s0, wi(w0, w1))))
  sseli(cv(s0), com, cab(s0, wi(w0, w1)))
  mp2an(wss(com, cab(s0, wi(w0, w1))), wcel(emptycls, cab(s0, wi(w0, w1))), wral(s1, com, wi(wcel(cv(s1), cab(s0, wi(w0, w1))), wcel(csuc(cv(s1)), cab(s0, wi(w0, w1))))))
  mpbir(wcel(emptycls, cab(s0, wi(w0, w1))), wi(w0, w2))
  elab(s0, emptycls, wi(w0, w1), wi(w0, w2))
  0ex()
  imbi2d(wceq(cv(s0), emptycls), w0, w1, w2)
  rgen(s1, com, wi(wcel(cv(s1), cab(s0, wi(w0, w1))), wcel(csuc(cv(s1)), cab(s0, wi(w0, w1)))))
  3imtr4g(wcel(cv(s1), com), wcel(cv(s1), cab(s0, wi(w0, w1))), wcel(csuc(cv(s1)), cab(s0, wi(w0, w1))), wi(w0, w3), wi(w0, w4))
  a2d(wcel(cv(s1), com), w0, w3, w4)
  elab(s0, cv(s1), wi(w0, w1), wi(w0, w3))
  imbi2d(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), w0, w1, w3)
  elab(s0, csuc(cv(s1)), wi(w0, w1), wi(w0, w4))
  sucex(cv(s1))
  vex(s1)
  imbi2d(wceq(cv(s0), csuc(cv(s1))), w0, w1, w4)
  peano5(s1, cab(s0, wi(w0, w1)))
  abid(s0, wi(w0, w1))
  diff.emptycls.s(s0)
  diff.wi.s(s0, w0, w2)
  diff.wi.s(s0, w0, w3)
  diff.csuc.s(s0, cv(s1))
  diff.cv.s(s0, s1)
  diff.wi.s(s0, w0, w4)
  diff.cab.s(s1, s0, wi(w0, w1))
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
  diff.wi.s(s1, w0, w1)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm finds2(setvar s0, setvar s1, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2, wff w3, wff w4) {
  ⊢ (s0 ∈ _om →(w0 → w1))
  ⊣ (s0 = ∅ →(w1 ↔ w2))
  ⊣ (s0 = s1 →(w1 ↔ w3))
  ⊣ (s0 = suc(s1)→(w1 ↔ w4))
  ⊣ (w0 → w2)
  ⊣ (s1 ∈ _om →(w0 →(w3 → w4)))
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, w0)
  ⊣ d(s0, w2)
  ⊣ d(s0, w3)
  ⊣ d(s0, w4)
  ⊣ d(s1, w0)
  ⊣ d(s1, w1)
} = {
  sylib(s0 ∈ _om, (w0 → w1), s0 ∈ { s0 |(w0 → w1)})
  sseli(s0, com, { s0 |(w0 → w1)})
  mp2an(_om ⊆ { s0 |(w0 → w1)}, ∅ ∈ { s0 |(w0 → w1)}, ∀(s1 ∈ _om,(s1 ∈ { s0 |(w0 → w1)} → suc(s1)∈ { s0 |(w0 → w1)})))
  mpbir(∅ ∈ { s0 |(w0 → w1)}, (w0 → w2))
  elab(s0, emptycls, (w0 → w1), (w0 → w2))
  0ex()
  imbi2d(s0 = ∅, w0, w1, w2)
  rgen(s1, com, (s1 ∈ { s0 |(w0 → w1)} → suc(s1)∈ { s0 |(w0 → w1)}))
  3imtr4g(s1 ∈ _om, s1 ∈ { s0 |(w0 → w1)}, suc(s1)∈ { s0 |(w0 → w1)}, (w0 → w3), (w0 → w4))
  a2d(s1 ∈ _om, w0, w3, w4)
  elab(s0, s1, (w0 → w1), (w0 → w3))
  imbi2d(s0 = s1, w0, w1, w3)
  elab(s0, suc(s1), (w0 → w1), (w0 → w4))
  sucex(s1)
  vex(s1)
  imbi2d(s0 = suc(s1), w0, w1, w4)
  peano5(s1, { s0 |(w0 → w1)})
  abid(s0, (w0 → w1))
  diff.emptycls.s(s0)
  diff.wi.s(s0, w0, w2)
  diff.wi.s(s0, w0, w3)
  diff.csuc.s(s0, s1)
  diff.cv.s(s0, s1)
  diff.wi.s(s0, w0, w4)
  diff.cab.s(s1, s0, (w0 → w1))
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
  diff.wi.s(s1, w0, w1)
}

blocks.name: finds1
blocks.content: Principle of Finite Induction (inference schema), using implicit substitutions. The first three hypotheses establish the substitutions we need. The last two are the basis and the induction step. Theorem Schema 22 of [Suppes] p. 136. (Contributed by NM, 22-Mar-2006.)
blocks.origin:
thm finds1(setvar s0, setvar s1, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2, wff w3) {
  |- wi(wcel(cv(s0), com), w0)
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), emptycls), wb(w0, w1))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wb(w0, w2))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), csuc(cv(s1))), wb(w0, w3))
  -| w1
  -| wi(wcel(cv(s1), com), wi(w2, w3))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsw(s0, w1)
  -| diffsw(s0, w2)
  -| diffsw(s0, w3)
  -| diffsw(s1, w0)
} = {
  mpi(wcel(cv(s0), com), w0, wceq(emptycls, emptycls))
  eqid(emptycls)
  finds2(s0, s1, wceq(emptycls, emptycls), w0, w1, w2, w3)
  a1i(wceq(emptycls, emptycls), w1)
  a1d(wcel(cv(s1), com), wceq(emptycls, emptycls), wi(w2, w3))
  diff.wceq.s(s0, emptycls, emptycls)
  diff.emptycls.s(s0)
  diff.wceq.s(s1, emptycls, emptycls)
  diff.emptycls.s(s1)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm finds1(setvar s0, setvar s1, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2, wff w3) {
  ⊢ (s0 ∈ _om → w0)
  ⊣ (s0 = ∅ →(w0 ↔ w1))
  ⊣ (s0 = s1 →(w0 ↔ w2))
  ⊣ (s0 = suc(s1)→(w0 ↔ w3))
  ⊣ w1
  ⊣ (s1 ∈ _om →(w2 → w3))
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, w1)
  ⊣ d(s0, w2)
  ⊣ d(s0, w3)
  ⊣ d(s1, w0)
} = {
  mpi(s0 ∈ _om, w0, ∅ = ∅)
  eqid(emptycls)
  finds2(s0, s1, ∅ = ∅, w0, w1, w2, w3)
  a1i(∅ = ∅, w1)
  a1d(s1 ∈ _om, ∅ = ∅, (w2 → w3))
  diff.wceq.s(s0, emptycls, emptycls)
  diff.emptycls.s(s0)
  diff.wceq.s(s1, emptycls, emptycls)
  diff.emptycls.s(s1)
}

blocks.name: findes
blocks.content: Finite induction with explicit substitution. The first hypothesis is the basis and the second is the induction step. Theorem Schema 22 of [Suppes] p. 136. See ~ tfindes for the transfinite version. This is an alternative for Metamath 100 proof #74. (Contributed by Raph Levien, 9-Jul-2003.)
blocks.origin:
thm findes(setvar s0, wff w0) {
  |- wi(wcel(cv(s0), com), w0)
  -| wsbc(s0, emptycls, w0)
  -| wi(wcel(cv(s0), com), wi(w0, wsbc(s0, csuc(cv(s0)), w0)))
} = {
  finds(hs0, hs1, cv(s0), w0, wsb(hs0, s0, w0), wsbc(s0, emptycls, w0), wsb(hs1, s0, w0), wsbc(s0, csuc(cv(hs1)), w0))
  dfsbcq2(hs0, s0, emptycls, w0)
  sbequ(hs0, hs1, s0, w0)
  dfsbcq2(hs0, s0, csuc(cv(hs1)), w0)
  sbequ12r(hs0, s0, w0)
  chvar(s0, hs1, wi(wcel(cv(hs1), com), wi(wsb(hs1, s0, w0), wsbc(s0, csuc(cv(hs1)), w0))), wi(wcel(cv(s0), com), wi(w0, wsbc(s0, csuc(cv(s0)), w0))))
  nfim(s0, wcel(cv(hs1), com), wi(wsb(hs1, s0, w0), wsbc(s0, csuc(cv(hs1)), w0)))
  nfv(s0, wcel(cv(hs1), com))
  nfim(s0, wsb(hs1, s0, w0), wsbc(s0, csuc(cv(hs1)), w0))
  nfs1v(s0, hs1, w0)
  nfsbc1v(s0, csuc(cv(hs1)), w0)
  imbi12d(wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs1)), wcel(cv(s0), com), wi(w0, wsbc(s0, csuc(cv(s0)), w0)), wcel(cv(hs1), com), wi(wsb(hs1, s0, w0), wsbc(s0, csuc(cv(hs1)), w0)))
  eleq1w(s0, hs1, com)
  imbi12d(wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs1)), w0, wsbc(s0, csuc(cv(s0)), w0), wsb(hs1, s0, w0), wsbc(s0, csuc(cv(hs1)), w0))
  sbequ12(s0, hs1, w0)
  sbceq1d(s0, csuc(cv(s0)), csuc(cv(hs1)), wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs1)), w0)
  suceq(cv(s0), cv(hs1))
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(cv(s0))
  diff.hs0.w(w0)
  diff.hs0.w(wsbc(s0, emptycls, w0))
  diff.hs0.w(wsb(hs1, s0, w0))
  diff.hs0.w(wsbc(s0, csuc(cv(hs1)), w0))
  diff.hs1.w(wsb(hs0, s0, w0))
  diff.wcel.s(s0, cv(hs1), com)
  diff.com.s(s0)
  diff.csuc.s(s0, cv(hs1))
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs1)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs1)
  diff.hs1.s(s0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm findes(setvar s0, wff w0) {
  ⊢ (s0 ∈ _om → w0)
  ⊣ [∅ / s0]w0
  ⊣ (s0 ∈ _om →(w0 →[suc(s0)/ s0]w0))
} = {
  finds(hs0, hs1, s0, w0, [hs0 / s0]w0, [∅ / s0]w0, [hs1 / s0]w0, [suc(hs1)/ s0]w0)
  dfsbcq2(hs0, s0, emptycls, w0)
  sbequ(hs0, hs1, s0, w0)
  dfsbcq2(hs0, s0, suc(hs1), w0)
  sbequ12r(hs0, s0, w0)
  chvar(s0, hs1, (hs1 ∈ _om →([hs1 / s0]w0 →[suc(hs1)/ s0]w0)), (s0 ∈ _om →(w0 →[suc(s0)/ s0]w0)))
  nfim(s0, hs1 ∈ _om, ([hs1 / s0]w0 →[suc(hs1)/ s0]w0))
  nfv(s0, hs1 ∈ _om)
  nfim(s0, [hs1 / s0]w0, [suc(hs1)/ s0]w0)
  nfs1v(s0, hs1, w0)
  nfsbc1v(s0, suc(hs1), w0)
  imbi12d(s0 = hs1, s0 ∈ _om, (w0 →[suc(s0)/ s0]w0), hs1 ∈ _om, ([hs1 / s0]w0 →[suc(hs1)/ s0]w0))
  eleq1w(s0, hs1, com)
  imbi12d(s0 = hs1, w0, [suc(s0)/ s0]w0, [hs1 / s0]w0, [suc(hs1)/ s0]w0)
  sbequ12(s0, hs1, w0)
  sbceq1d(s0, suc(s0), suc(hs1), s0 = hs1, w0)
  suceq(s0, hs1)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(s0)
  diff.hs0.w(w0)
  diff.hs0.w([∅ / s0]w0)
  diff.hs0.w([hs1 / s0]w0)
  diff.hs0.w([suc(hs1)/ s0]w0)
  diff.hs1.w([hs0 / s0]w0)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, hs1, com)
  diff.com.s(s0)
  diff.csuc.s(s0, hs1)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs1)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs1)
  diff.hs1.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: dmexg

blocks.name: iprc
blocks.content: The identity function is a proper class. This means, for example, that we cannot use it as a member of the class of continuous functions unless it is restricted to a set, as in ~ idcn . (Contributed by NM, 1-Jan-2007.)

blocks.name: resiexg
blocks.content: The existence of a restricted identity function, proved without using the Axiom of Replacement (unlike ~ resfunexg ). (Contributed by NM, 13-Jan-2007.) (Proof shortened by Peter Mazsa, 2-Oct-2022.)

blocks.name: imaexg
blocks.content: The image of a set is a set. Theorem 3.17 of [Monk1] p. 39. (Contributed by NM, 24-Jul-1995.)

blocks.content: The image of a set is a set. Theorem 3.17 of [Monk1] p. 39. (Contributed by JJ, 24-Sep-2021.)

thm exse2(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wse(c0, c2))
} = {
  sylibr(wcel(c0, c1), wse(c0, c2), wral(hs1, c2, wcel(crab(hs0, c2, wbr(cv(hs0), c0, cv(hs1))), universe)))
  ralrimivw(hs1, c2, wcel(c0, c1), wcel(crab(hs0, c2, wbr(cv(hs0), c0, cv(hs1))), universe))
  sylancr(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(crab(hs0, c2, wbr(cv(hs0), c0, cv(hs1))), universe), wss(crab(hs0, c2, wbr(cv(hs0), c0, cv(hs1))), cdm(c0)), wcel(cdm(c0), universe))
  eqsstri(crab(hs0, c2, wbr(cv(hs0), c0, cv(hs1))), cdm(c0), cab(hs0, wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c2), wbr(cv(hs0), c0, cv(hs1)))))
  df-rab(hs0, c2, wbr(cv(hs0), c0, cv(hs1)))
  abssi(hs0, cdm(c0), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c2), wbr(cv(hs0), c0, cv(hs1))))
  adantl(wcel(cv(hs0), c2), wbr(cv(hs0), c0, cv(hs1)), wcel(cv(hs0), cdm(c0)))
  breldm(cv(hs0), c0, cv(hs1))
  vex(hs0)
  vex(hs1)
  dmexg(c0, c1)
  ssexg(crab(hs0, c2, wbr(cv(hs0), c0, cv(hs1))), cdm(c0), universe)
  df-se(hs1, hs0, c0, c2)
  diff.hs1.w(wcel(c0, c1))
  diff.hs0.c(cdm(c0))
  diff.hs1.s(hs0)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm exse2(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ c1 → c0[Se]c2)
} = {
  sylibr(c0 ∈ c1, c0[Se]c2, ∀(hs1 ∈ c2, { hs0 ∈ c2 | hs0[c0]hs1 } ∈ 𝕌))
  ralrimivw(hs1, c2, c0 ∈ c1, { hs0 ∈ c2 | hs0[c0]hs1 } ∈ 𝕌)
  sylancr(c0 ∈ c1, { hs0 ∈ c2 | hs0[c0]hs1 } ∈ 𝕌, { hs0 ∈ c2 | hs0[c0]hs1 } ⊆ dom(c0), dom(c0)∈ 𝕌)
  eqsstri({ hs0 ∈ c2 | hs0[c0]hs1 }, dom(c0), { hs0 |(hs0 ∈ c2 ∧ hs0[c0]hs1)})
  df-rab(hs0, c2, hs0[c0]hs1)
  abssi(hs0, dom(c0), (hs0 ∈ c2 ∧ hs0[c0]hs1))
  adantl(hs0 ∈ c2, hs0[c0]hs1, hs0 ∈ dom(c0))
  breldm(hs0, c0, hs1)
  vex(hs0)
  vex(hs1)
  dmexg(c0, c1)
  ssexg({ hs0 ∈ c2 | hs0[c0]hs1 }, dom(c0), universe)
  df-se(hs1, hs0, c0, c2)
  diff.hs1.w(c0 ∈ c1)
  diff.hs0.c(dom(c0))
  diff.hs1.s(hs0)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
}

blocks.name: xpexr
blocks.content: If a Cartesian product is a set, one of its components must be a set. (Contributed by NM, 27-Aug-2006.)
blocks.origin:
thm xpexr(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wcel(cxp(c0, c1), c2), wo(wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c1, universe)))
} = {
  orrd(wcel(cxp(c0, c1), c2), wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c1, universe))
  pm2.61ine(c0, emptycls, wi(wcel(cxp(c0, c1), c2), wi(wn(wcel(c0, universe)), wcel(c1, universe))))
  a1d(wceq(c0, emptycls), wcel(cxp(c0, c1), c2), wi(wn(wcel(c0, universe)), wcel(c1, universe)))
  pm2.24d(wceq(c0, emptycls), wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c1, universe))
  mpbiri(wceq(c0, emptycls), wcel(c0, universe), wcel(emptycls, universe))
  0ex()
  eleq1(c0, emptycls, universe)
  a1dd(wne(c0, emptycls), wcel(cxp(c0, c1), c2), wn(wcel(c0, universe)), wcel(c1, universe))
  syl5ib(wne(c0, emptycls), wcel(cxp(c0, c1), c2), wcel(c1, universe), wcel(crn(cxp(c0, c1)), universe))
  rnexg(cxp(c0, c1), c2)
  eleq1d(crn(cxp(c0, c1)), universe, c1, wne(c0, emptycls))
  rnxp(c0, c1)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm xpexr(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  ⊢ ((c0 × c1)∈ c2 →(c0 ∈ 𝕌 ∨ c1 ∈ 𝕌))
} = {
  orrd((c0 × c1)∈ c2, c0 ∈ 𝕌, c1 ∈ 𝕌)
  pm2.61ine(c0, emptycls, ((c0 × c1)∈ c2 →(¬ c0 ∈ 𝕌 → c1 ∈ 𝕌)))
  a1d(c0 = ∅, (c0 × c1)∈ c2, (¬ c0 ∈ 𝕌 → c1 ∈ 𝕌))
  pm2.24d(c0 = ∅, c0 ∈ 𝕌, c1 ∈ 𝕌)
  mpbiri(c0 = ∅, c0 ∈ 𝕌, ∅ ∈ 𝕌)
  0ex()
  eleq1(c0, emptycls, universe)
  a1dd(c0 ≠ ∅, (c0 × c1)∈ c2, ¬ c0 ∈ 𝕌, c1 ∈ 𝕌)
  syl5ib(c0 ≠ ∅, (c0 × c1)∈ c2, c1 ∈ 𝕌, ran((c0 × c1))∈ 𝕌)
  rnexg((c0 × c1), c2)
  eleq1d(ran((c0 × c1)), universe, c1, c0 ≠ ∅)
  rnxp(c0, c1)
}

blocks.name: xpexr2
blocks.content: If a nonempty Cartesian product is a set, so are both of its components. (Contributed by NM, 27-Aug-2006.)
blocks.origin:
thm xpexr2(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(cxp(c0, c1), c2), wne(cxp(c0, c1), emptycls)), wa(wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c1, universe)))
} = {
  sylan2br(wcel(cxp(c0, c1), c2), wne(cxp(c0, c1), emptycls), wa(wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c1, universe)), wa(wne(c0, emptycls), wne(c1, emptycls)))
  xpnz(c0, c1)
  ancom2s(wcel(cxp(c0, c1), c2), wne(c0, emptycls), wne(c1, emptycls), wa(wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c1, universe)))
  anim12dan(wcel(cxp(c0, c1), c2), wne(c1, emptycls), wne(c0, emptycls), wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c1, universe))
  eqeltrrd(c0, universe, cdm(cxp(c0, c1)), wa(wcel(cxp(c0, c1), c2), wne(c1, emptycls)))
  adantl(wcel(cxp(c0, c1), c2), wne(c1, emptycls), wceq(cdm(cxp(c0, c1)), c0))
  dmxp(c1, c0)
  adantr(wcel(cxp(c0, c1), c2), wne(c1, emptycls), wcel(cdm(cxp(c0, c1)), universe))
  dmexg(cxp(c0, c1), c2)
  eqeltrrd(c1, universe, crn(cxp(c0, c1)), wa(wcel(cxp(c0, c1), c2), wne(c0, emptycls)))
  adantl(wcel(cxp(c0, c1), c2), wne(c0, emptycls), wceq(crn(cxp(c0, c1)), c1))
  rnxp(c0, c1)
  adantr(wcel(cxp(c0, c1), c2), wne(c0, emptycls), wcel(crn(cxp(c0, c1)), universe))
  rnexg(cxp(c0, c1), c2)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm xpexr2(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  ⊢ (((c0 × c1)∈ c2 ∧(c0 × c1)≠ ∅)→(c0 ∈ 𝕌 ∧ c1 ∈ 𝕌))
} = {
  sylan2br((c0 × c1)∈ c2, (c0 × c1)≠ ∅, (c0 ∈ 𝕌 ∧ c1 ∈ 𝕌), (c0 ≠ ∅ ∧ c1 ≠ ∅))
  xpnz(c0, c1)
  ancom2s((c0 × c1)∈ c2, c0 ≠ ∅, c1 ≠ ∅, (c0 ∈ 𝕌 ∧ c1 ∈ 𝕌))
  anim12dan((c0 × c1)∈ c2, c1 ≠ ∅, c0 ≠ ∅, c0 ∈ 𝕌, c1 ∈ 𝕌)
  eqeltrrd(c0, universe, dom((c0 × c1)), ((c0 × c1)∈ c2 ∧ c1 ≠ ∅))
  adantl((c0 × c1)∈ c2, c1 ≠ ∅, dom((c0 × c1))= c0)
  dmxp(c1, c0)
  adantr((c0 × c1)∈ c2, c1 ≠ ∅, dom((c0 × c1))∈ 𝕌)
  dmexg((c0 × c1), c2)
  eqeltrrd(c1, universe, ran((c0 × c1)), ((c0 × c1)∈ c2 ∧ c0 ≠ ∅))
  adantl((c0 × c1)∈ c2, c0 ≠ ∅, ran((c0 × c1))= c1)
  rnxp(c0, c1)
  adantr((c0 × c1)∈ c2, c0 ≠ ∅, ran((c0 × c1))∈ 𝕌)
  rnexg((c0 × c1), c2)
}

blocks.name: xpexcnv
blocks.content: A condition where the converse of ~ xpex holds as well. Corollary 6.9(2) in [TakeutiZaring] p. 26. (Contributed by Andrew Salmon, 13-Nov-2011.)

blocks.name: soex
blocks.content: If the relation in a strict order is a set, then the base field is also a set. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 27-Apr-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm soex(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wa(wor(c0, c1), wcel(c0, c2)), wcel(c1, universe))
} = {
  pm2.61dane(c1, emptycls, wa(wor(c0, c1), wcel(c0, c2)), wcel(c1, universe))
  syl6eqel(c1, universe, emptycls, wa(wa(wor(c0, c1), wcel(c0, c2)), wceq(c1, emptycls)))
  simpr(wa(wor(c0, c1), wcel(c0, c2)), wceq(c1, emptycls))
  0ex()
  sylan2b(wa(wor(c0, c1), wcel(c0, c2)), wne(c1, emptycls), wcel(c1, universe), wex(hs0, wcel(cv(hs0), c1)))
  n0(hs0, c1)
  imp(wa(wor(c0, c1), wcel(c0, c2)), wex(hs0, wcel(cv(hs0), c1)), wcel(c1, universe))
  exlimdv(hs0, wa(wor(c0, c1), wcel(c0, c2)), wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(c1, universe))
  ex(wa(wor(c0, c1), wcel(c0, c2)), wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(c1, universe))
  ssexd(c1, cun(csn(cv(hs0)), cun(cdm(c0), crn(c0))), universe, wa(wa(wor(c0, c1), wcel(c0, c2)), wcel(cv(hs0), c1)))
  ad2antlr(wor(c0, c1), wcel(c0, c2), wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cun(csn(cv(hs0)), cun(cdm(c0), crn(c0))), universe))
  sylancr(wcel(c0, c2), wcel(cun(csn(cv(hs0)), cun(cdm(c0), crn(c0))), universe), wcel(csn(cv(hs0)), universe), wcel(cun(cdm(c0), crn(c0)), universe))
  snex(cv(hs0))
  syl2anc(wcel(c0, c2), wcel(cun(cdm(c0), crn(c0)), universe), wcel(cdm(c0), universe), wcel(crn(c0), universe))
  dmexg(c0, c2)
  rnexg(c0, c2)
  unexg(cdm(c0), universe, crn(c0), universe)
  unexg(csn(cv(hs0)), universe, cun(cdm(c0), crn(c0)), universe)
  sylibr(wa(wa(wor(c0, c1), wcel(c0, c2)), wcel(cv(hs0), c1)), wss(c1, cun(csn(cv(hs0)), cun(cdm(c0), crn(c0)))), wss(cdif(c1, csn(cv(hs0))), cun(cdm(c0), crn(c0))))
  adantlr(wor(c0, c1), wcel(c0, c2), wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wss(cdif(c1, csn(cv(hs0))), cun(cdm(c0), crn(c0))))
  sossfld(c0, c1, cv(hs0))
  ssundif(c1, csn(cv(hs0)), cun(cdm(c0), crn(c0)))
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.w(wa(wor(c0, c1), wcel(c0, c2)))
  diff.hs0.w(wcel(c1, universe))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm soex(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ≺ c1 ∧ c0 ∈ c2)→ c1 ∈ 𝕌)
} = {
  pm2.61dane(c1, emptycls, (c0 ≺ c1 ∧ c0 ∈ c2), c1 ∈ 𝕌)
  syl6eqel(c1, universe, emptycls, ((c0 ≺ c1 ∧ c0 ∈ c2)∧ c1 = ∅))
  simpr((c0 ≺ c1 ∧ c0 ∈ c2), c1 = ∅)
  0ex()
  sylan2b((c0 ≺ c1 ∧ c0 ∈ c2), c1 ≠ ∅, c1 ∈ 𝕌, ∃(hs0, hs0 ∈ c1))
  n0(hs0, c1)
  imp((c0 ≺ c1 ∧ c0 ∈ c2), ∃(hs0, hs0 ∈ c1), c1 ∈ 𝕌)
  exlimdv(hs0, (c0 ≺ c1 ∧ c0 ∈ c2), hs0 ∈ c1, c1 ∈ 𝕌)
  ex((c0 ≺ c1 ∧ c0 ∈ c2), hs0 ∈ c1, c1 ∈ 𝕌)
  ssexd(c1, ({ hs0 } ⋃(dom(c0)⋃ ran(c0))), universe, ((c0 ≺ c1 ∧ c0 ∈ c2)∧ hs0 ∈ c1))
  ad2antlr(c0 ≺ c1, c0 ∈ c2, hs0 ∈ c1, ({ hs0 } ⋃(dom(c0)⋃ ran(c0)))∈ 𝕌)
  sylancr(c0 ∈ c2, ({ hs0 } ⋃(dom(c0)⋃ ran(c0)))∈ 𝕌, { hs0 } ∈ 𝕌, (dom(c0)⋃ ran(c0))∈ 𝕌)
  snex(hs0)
  syl2anc(c0 ∈ c2, (dom(c0)⋃ ran(c0))∈ 𝕌, dom(c0)∈ 𝕌, ran(c0)∈ 𝕌)
  dmexg(c0, c2)
  rnexg(c0, c2)
  unexg(dom(c0), universe, ran(c0), universe)
  unexg({ hs0 }, universe, (dom(c0)⋃ ran(c0)), universe)
  sylibr(((c0 ≺ c1 ∧ c0 ∈ c2)∧ hs0 ∈ c1), c1 ⊆({ hs0 } ⋃(dom(c0)⋃ ran(c0))), (c1 \ { hs0 })⊆(dom(c0)⋃ ran(c0)))
  adantlr(c0 ≺ c1, c0 ∈ c2, hs0 ∈ c1, (c1 \ { hs0 })⊆(dom(c0)⋃ ran(c0)))
  sossfld(c0, c1, hs0)
  ssundif(c1, { hs0 }, (dom(c0)⋃ ran(c0)))
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.w((c0 ≺ c1 ∧ c0 ∈ c2))
  diff.hs0.w(c1 ∈ 𝕌)
}

blocks.name: elxp4
blocks.content: Membership in a Cartesian product. This version requires no quantifiers or dummy variables. See also ~ elxp5 , ~ elxp6 , and ~ elxp7 . (Contributed by NM, 17-Feb-2004.)
blocks.origin:
thm elxp4(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wb(wcel(c0, cxp(c1, c2)), wa(wceq(c0, cop(cuni(cdm(csn(c0))), cuni(crn(csn(c0))))), wa(wcel(cuni(cdm(csn(c0))), c1), wcel(cuni(crn(csn(c0))), c2))))
} = {
  3bitri(wcel(c0, cxp(c1, c2)), wa(wceq(c0, cop(cuni(cdm(csn(c0))), cuni(crn(csn(c0))))), wa(wcel(cuni(cdm(csn(c0))), c1), wcel(cuni(crn(csn(c0))), c2))), wex(hs0, wex(hs1, wa(wceq(c0, cop(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cv(hs1), c2))))), wex(hs0, wa(wceq(cv(hs0), cuni(cdm(csn(c0)))), wa(wceq(c0, cop(cv(hs0), cuni(crn(csn(c0))))), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cuni(crn(csn(c0))), c2))))))
  elxp(hs0, hs1, c0, c1, c2)
  exbii(hs0, wex(hs1, wa(wceq(c0, cop(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cv(hs1), c2)))), wa(wceq(cv(hs0), cuni(cdm(csn(c0)))), wa(wceq(c0, cop(cv(hs0), cuni(crn(csn(c0))))), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cuni(crn(csn(c0))), c2)))))
  3bitri(wex(hs1, wa(wceq(c0, cop(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cv(hs1), c2)))), wa(wceq(cv(hs0), cuni(cdm(csn(c0)))), wa(wceq(c0, cop(cv(hs0), cuni(crn(csn(c0))))), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cuni(crn(csn(c0))), c2)))), wa(wceq(c0, cop(cv(hs0), cuni(crn(csn(c0))))), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cuni(crn(csn(c0))), c2))), wa(wa(wceq(cv(hs0), cuni(cdm(csn(c0)))), wceq(c0, cop(cv(hs0), cuni(crn(csn(c0)))))), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cuni(crn(csn(c0))), c2))))
  bitri(wex(hs1, wa(wceq(c0, cop(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cv(hs1), c2)))), wa(wceq(c0, cop(cv(hs0), cuni(crn(csn(c0))))), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cuni(crn(csn(c0))), c2))), wex(hs1, wa(wceq(cv(hs1), cuni(crn(csn(c0)))), wa(wceq(c0, cop(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cv(hs1), c2))))))
  exbii(hs1, wa(wceq(c0, cop(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cv(hs1), c2))), wa(wceq(cv(hs1), cuni(crn(csn(c0)))), wa(wceq(c0, cop(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cv(hs1), c2)))))
  bitri(wa(wceq(c0, cop(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cv(hs1), c2))), wa(wceq(cv(hs1), cuni(crn(csn(c0)))), wa(wceq(c0, cop(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cv(hs1), c2)))), wa(wa(wceq(cv(hs1), cuni(crn(csn(c0)))), wceq(c0, cop(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)))), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cv(hs1), c2))))
  anbi1i(wceq(c0, cop(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cv(hs1), c2)), wa(wceq(cv(hs1), cuni(crn(csn(c0)))), wceq(c0, cop(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)))))
  pm4.71ri(wceq(c0, cop(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))), wceq(cv(hs1), cuni(crn(csn(c0)))))
  syl6req(cv(hs1), cuni(crn(csn(c0))), cuni(crn(csn(cop(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))))), wceq(c0, cop(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))))
  unieqd(crn(csn(c0)), crn(csn(cop(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)))), wceq(c0, cop(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))))
  rneqd(csn(c0), csn(cop(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))), wceq(c0, cop(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))))
  sneq(c0, cop(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)))
  op2nda(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))
  vex(hs1)
  anass(wceq(cv(hs1), cuni(crn(csn(c0)))), wceq(c0, cop(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cv(hs1), c2)))
  ceqsexv(hs1, cuni(crn(csn(c0))), wa(wceq(c0, cop(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cv(hs1), c2))), wa(wceq(c0, cop(cv(hs0), cuni(crn(csn(c0))))), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cuni(crn(csn(c0))), c2))))
  anbi12d(wceq(cv(hs1), cuni(crn(csn(c0)))), wceq(c0, cop(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cv(hs1), c2)), wceq(c0, cop(cv(hs0), cuni(crn(csn(c0))))), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cuni(crn(csn(c0))), c2)))
  eqeq2d(c0, cop(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), cop(cv(hs0), cuni(crn(csn(c0)))), wceq(cv(hs1), cuni(crn(csn(c0)))))
  opeq2(cv(hs1), cuni(crn(csn(c0))), cv(hs0))
  anbi2d(wceq(cv(hs1), cuni(crn(csn(c0)))), wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cv(hs1), c2), wcel(cuni(crn(csn(c0))), c2))
  eleq1(cv(hs1), cuni(crn(csn(c0))), c2)
  anbi1i(wceq(c0, cop(cv(hs0), cuni(crn(csn(c0))))), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cuni(crn(csn(c0))), c2)), wa(wceq(cv(hs0), cuni(cdm(csn(c0)))), wceq(c0, cop(cv(hs0), cuni(crn(csn(c0)))))))
  pm4.71ri(wceq(c0, cop(cv(hs0), cuni(crn(csn(c0))))), wceq(cv(hs0), cuni(cdm(csn(c0)))))
  syl6req(cv(hs0), cuni(cdm(csn(c0))), cuni(cdm(csn(cop(cv(hs0), cuni(crn(csn(c0))))))), wceq(c0, cop(cv(hs0), cuni(crn(csn(c0))))))
  unieqd(cdm(csn(c0)), cdm(csn(cop(cv(hs0), cuni(crn(csn(c0)))))), wceq(c0, cop(cv(hs0), cuni(crn(csn(c0))))))
  dmeqd(csn(c0), csn(cop(cv(hs0), cuni(crn(csn(c0))))), wceq(c0, cop(cv(hs0), cuni(crn(csn(c0))))))
  sneq(c0, cop(cv(hs0), cuni(crn(csn(c0)))))
  op1sta(cv(hs0), cuni(crn(csn(c0))))
  vex(hs0)
  uniex(crn(csn(c0)))

blocks.content: Membership in a Cartesian product requiring no quantifiers or dummy variables. Provides a slightly shorter version of ~ elxp4 when the double intersection does not create class existence problems (caused by ~ int0 ). (Contributed by NM, 1-Aug-2004.)

blocks.name: cnvexg
blocks.content: The converse of a set is a set. Corollary 6.8(1) of [TakeutiZaring] p. 26. (Contributed by NM, 17-Mar-1998.)
blocks.origin:
thm cnvexg(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(ccnv(c0), universe))
} = {
  sylancr(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(ccnv(c0), universe), wss(ccnv(c0), cxp(cdm(ccnv(c0)), crn(ccnv(c0)))), wcel(cxp(cdm(ccnv(c0)), crn(ccnv(c0))), universe))
  ax-mp(wss(ccnv(c0), cxp(cdm(ccnv(c0)), crn(ccnv(c0)))), wrel(ccnv(c0)))
  relcnv(c0)
  relssdmrn(ccnv(c0))
  xpexd(cdm(ccnv(c0)), crn(ccnv(c0)), universe, universe, wcel(c0, c1))
  syl5eqelr(cdm(ccnv(c0)), universe, crn(c0), wcel(c0, c1))
  df-rn(c0)
  rnexg(c0, c1)
  syl5eqelr(crn(ccnv(c0)), universe, cdm(c0), wcel(c0, c1))
  dfdm4(c0)
  dmexg(c0, c1)
  ssexg(ccnv(c0), cxp(cdm(ccnv(c0)), crn(ccnv(c0))), universe)
}

} = {

blocks.name: cnvex
blocks.content: The converse of a set is a set. Corollary 6.8(1) of [TakeutiZaring] p. 26. (Contributed by NM, 19-Dec-2003.)

blocks.name: relcnvexb
blocks.content: A relation is a set iff its converse is a set. (Contributed by FL, 3-Mar-2007.)

blocks.name: f1oexrnex
blocks.content: If the range of a 1-1 onto function is a set, the function itself is a set. (Contributed by AV, 2-Jun-2019.)
blocks.origin:
thm f1oexrnex(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wa(wf1o(c0, c1, c2), wcel(c2, c3)), wcel(c0, universe))
} = {

  sylancom(wf1o(c0, c1, c2), wcel(c2, c3), wcel(ccnv(c0), universe), wf(ccnv(c0), c2, c1))
  3syl(wa(wf1o(c0, c1, c2), wcel(c2, c3)), wf(ccnv(c0), c2, c1), wf1o(c0, c1, c2), wf1o(ccnv(c0), c2, c1))
  simpl(wf1o(c0, c1, c2), wcel(c2, c3))
  f1ocnv(c0, c1, c2)
  f1of(ccnv(c0), c2, c1)
  fex(ccnv(c0), c2, c1, c3)
  syl(wa(wf1o(c0, c1, c2), wcel(c2, c3)), wb(wcel(c0, universe), wcel(ccnv(c0), universe)), wrel(c0))
  adantr(wf1o(c0, c1, c2), wcel(c2, c3), wrel(c0))
  f1orel(c0, c1, c2)
  relcnvexb(c0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm f1oexrnex(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  ⊢ (((c0 : c1 ↔ c2)∧ c2 ∈ c3)→ c0 ∈ 𝕌)
} = {
  mpbird(((c0 : c1 ↔ c2)∧ c2 ∈ c3), c0 ∈ 𝕌, `' c0 ∈ 𝕌)
  sylancom((c0 : c1 ↔ c2), c2 ∈ c3, `' c0 ∈ 𝕌, (`' c0 : c2 → c1))
  3syl(((c0 : c1 ↔ c2)∧ c2 ∈ c3), (`' c0 : c2 → c1), (c0 : c1 ↔ c2), (`' c0 : c2 ↔ c1))
  simpl((c0 : c1 ↔ c2), c2 ∈ c3)

blocks.name: f1oexbi
blocks.content: There is a one-to-one onto function from a set to a second set iff there is a one-to-one onto function from the second set to the first set. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 30-Sep-2018.)
blocks.origin:
thm f1oexbi(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1) {

  -| diffss(s0, s1)

  -| diffsc(s0, c1)

} = {

  f1oeq1(cv(s1), ccnv(cv(s0)), c1, c0)
  exlimiv(s1, wf1o(cv(s1), c1, c0), wex(s0, wf1o(cv(s0), c0, c1)))
  mpsyl(wf1o(cv(s1), c1, c0), wex(s0, wf1o(cv(s0), c0, c1)), wcel(ccnv(cv(s1)), universe), wf1o(ccnv(cv(s1)), c0, c1))
  cnvex(cv(s1))
  vex(s1)
  f1ocnv(cv(s1), c1, c0)
  spcegv(s0, ccnv(cv(s1)), universe, wf1o(ccnv(cv(s1)), c0, c1), wf1o(cv(s0), c0, c1))
  f1oeq1(cv(s0), ccnv(cv(s1)), c0, c1)
  diff.wex.s(s0, s1, wf1o(cv(s1), c1, c0))
  diff.wf1o.s(s0, cv(s1), c1, c0)

  diff.cv.s(s0, s1)
}

thm f1oexbi(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ (∃(s0,(s0 : c0 ↔ c1))↔ ∃(s1,(s1 : c1 ↔ c0)))

  mpsyl((s1 : c1 ↔ c0), ∃(s0,(s0 : c0 ↔ c1)), `' s1 ∈ 𝕌, (`' s1 : c0 ↔ c1))
  cnvex(s1)

  f1ocnv(s1, c1, c0)
  spcegv(s0, `' s1, universe, (`' s1 : c0 ↔ c1), (s0 : c0 ↔ c1))
  f1oeq1(s0, `' s1, c0, c1)
  diff.wex.s(s0, s1, (s1 : c1 ↔ c0))
  diff.wf1o.s(s0, s1, c1, c0)
  diff.wf1o.s(s1, `' s0, c1, c0)
  diff.ccnv.s(s1, s0)
  diff.wex.s(s1, s0, (s0 : c0 ↔ c1))
  diff.wf1o.s(s1, s0, c0, c1)
  diff.cv.s(s1, s0)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)

  diff.ccnv.s(s0, s1)
  diff.cv.s(s0, s1)
}

blocks.name: fun11uni
blocks.content: The union of a chain (with respect to inclusion) of one-to-one functions is a one-to-one function. (Contributed by NM, 11-Aug-2004.)
blocks.origin:
thm fun11uni(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0) {
  |- wi(wral(s0, c0, wa(wa(wfun(cv(s0)), wfun(ccnv(cv(s0)))), wral(s1, c0, wo(wss(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wss(cv(s1), cv(s0)))))), wa(wfun(cuni(c0)), wfun(ccnv(cuni(c0)))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
} = {
  jca(wral(s0, c0, wa(wa(wfun(cv(s0)), wfun(ccnv(cv(s0)))), wral(s1, c0, wo(wss(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wss(cv(s1), cv(s0)))))), wfun(cuni(c0)), wfun(ccnv(cuni(c0))))
  syl(wral(s0, c0, wa(wa(wfun(cv(s0)), wfun(ccnv(cv(s0)))), wral(s1, c0, wo(wss(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wss(cv(s1), cv(s0)))))), wfun(cuni(c0)), wral(s0, c0, wa(wfun(cv(s0)), wral(s1, c0, wo(wss(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wss(cv(s1), cv(s0)))))))
  ralimi(s0, c0, wa(wa(wfun(cv(s0)), wfun(ccnv(cv(s0)))), wral(s1, c0, wo(wss(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wss(cv(s1), cv(s0))))), wa(wfun(cv(s0)), wral(s1, c0, wo(wss(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wss(cv(s1), cv(s0))))))
  anim1i(wa(wfun(cv(s0)), wfun(ccnv(cv(s0)))), wral(s1, c0, wo(wss(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wss(cv(s1), cv(s0)))), wfun(cv(s0)))
  simpl(wfun(cv(s0)), wfun(ccnv(cv(s0))))
  fununi(s0, s1, c0)
  syl(wral(s0, c0, wa(wa(wfun(cv(s0)), wfun(ccnv(cv(s0)))), wral(s1, c0, wo(wss(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wss(cv(s1), cv(s0)))))), wfun(ccnv(cuni(c0))), wral(s0, c0, wa(wfun(ccnv(cv(s0))), wral(s1, c0, wo(wss(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wss(cv(s1), cv(s0)))))))
  ralimi(s0, c0, wa(wa(wfun(cv(s0)), wfun(ccnv(cv(s0)))), wral(s1, c0, wo(wss(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wss(cv(s1), cv(s0))))), wa(wfun(ccnv(cv(s0))), wral(s1, c0, wo(wss(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wss(cv(s1), cv(s0))))))
  anim1i(wa(wfun(cv(s0)), wfun(ccnv(cv(s0)))), wral(s1, c0, wo(wss(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wss(cv(s1), cv(s0)))), wfun(ccnv(cv(s0))))
  simpr(wfun(cv(s0)), wfun(ccnv(cv(s0))))
  funcnvuni(s0, s1, c0)
}

blocks.name: fex2

blocks.name: fabexg

thm fabexg(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, wff w0) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)), wcel(c4, universe))
  -| wceq(c4, cab(s0, wa(wf(cv(s0), c0, c2), w0)))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
} = {
  3syl(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)), wcel(c4, universe), wcel(cxp(c0, c2), universe), wcel(cpw(cxp(c0, c2)), universe))
  xpexg(c0, c1, c2, c3)
  pwexg(cxp(c0, c2), universe)
  mpan(wcel(cpw(cxp(c0, c2)), universe), wcel(c4, universe), wss(c4, cpw(cxp(c0, c2))))

  eqsstri(c4, cab(s0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), cpw(cxp(c0, c2))), w0)), cab(s0, wa(wf(cv(s0), c0, c2), w0)))

  anim1i(wf(cv(s0), c0, c2), w0, wcel(cv(s0), cpw(cxp(c0, c2))))
  sylibr(wf(cv(s0), c0, c2), wcel(cv(s0), cpw(cxp(c0, c2))), wss(cv(s0), cxp(c0, c2)))

}
blocks.pretty:
thm fabexg(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, wff w0) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ c1 ∧ c2 ∈ c3)→ c4 ∈ 𝕌)
  ⊣ c4 = { s0 |((s0 : c0 → c2)∧ w0)}
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c2)
} = {
  3syl((c0 ∈ c1 ∧ c2 ∈ c3), c4 ∈ 𝕌, (c0 × c2)∈ 𝕌, P((c0 × c2))∈ 𝕌)
  xpexg(c0, c1, c2, c3)
  pwexg((c0 × c2), universe)
  mpan(P((c0 × c2))∈ 𝕌, c4 ∈ 𝕌, c4 ⊆ P((c0 × c2)))
  sstri(c4, P((c0 × c2)), { s0 |(s0 ∈ P((c0 × c2))∧ w0)})
  eqsstri(c4, { s0 |(s0 ∈ P((c0 × c2))∧ w0)}, { s0 |((s0 : c0 → c2)∧ w0)})
  ss2abi(s0, ((s0 : c0 → c2)∧ w0), (s0 ∈ P((c0 × c2))∧ w0))
  anim1i((s0 : c0 → c2), w0, s0 ∈ P((c0 × c2)))
  sylibr((s0 : c0 → c2), s0 ∈ P((c0 × c2)), s0 ⊆(c0 × c2))
  fssxp(s0, c0, c2)
  selpw(s0, (c0 × c2))
  ssab2(s0, P((c0 × c2)), w0)
  ssexg(c4, P((c0 × c2)), universe)
  diff.cpw.s(s0, (c0 × c2))
  diff.cxp.s(s0, c0, c2)
}

blocks.name: fabex
blocks.content: Existence of a set of functions. (Contributed by NM, 3-Dec-2007.)

blocks.name: dmfex
blocks.content: If a mapping is a set, its domain is a set. (Contributed by NM, 27-Aug-2006.) (Proof shortened by Andrew Salmon, 17-Sep-2011.)

blocks.name: f1oabexg
blocks.content: The class of all 1-1-onto functions mapping one set to another is a set. (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 25-Feb-2008.)
blocks.origin:
thm f1oabexg(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, wff w0) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)), wcel(c4, universe))
  -| wceq(c4, cab(s0, wa(wf1o(cv(s0), c0, c2), w0)))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
} = {
  syl5eqel(c4, universe, cab(s0, wa(wf1o(cv(s0), c0, c2), w0)), wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)))
  sylancr(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)), wcel(cab(s0, wa(wf1o(cv(s0), c0, c2), w0)), universe), wss(cab(s0, wa(wf1o(cv(s0), c0, c2), w0)), cab(s0, wa(wf(cv(s0), c0, c2), w0))), wcel(cab(s0, wa(wf(cv(s0), c0, c2), w0)), universe))
  ss2abi(s0, wa(wf1o(cv(s0), c0, c2), w0), wa(wf(cv(s0), c0, c2), w0))
  anim1i(wf1o(cv(s0), c0, c2), w0, wf(cv(s0), c0, c2))
  f1of(cv(s0), c0, c2)
  fabexg(s0, c0, c1, c2, c3, cab(s0, wa(wf(cv(s0), c0, c2), w0)), w0)
  eqid(cab(s0, wa(wf(cv(s0), c0, c2), w0)))
  ssexg(cab(s0, wa(wf1o(cv(s0), c0, c2), w0)), cab(s0, wa(wf(cv(s0), c0, c2), w0)), universe)
}

  expdimp(wo(wss(c1, c4), wss(c4, c1)), wceq(cv(hs2), c4), wceq(cv(hs1), c1), wo(wss(cv(hs1), cv(hs2)), wss(cv(hs2), cv(hs1))))
  biimprcd(wo(wss(c1, c4), wss(c4, c1)), wa(wceq(cv(hs2), c4), wceq(cv(hs1), c1)), wo(wss(cv(hs1), cv(hs2)), wss(cv(hs2), cv(hs1))))

  diff.hs1.w(wral(s0, c0, wa(wf1(c1, c2, c3), wral(s1, c0, wo(wss(c1, c4), wss(c4, c1))))))
  diff.hs0.c(cv(hs1))

blocks.name: ffoss
blocks.content: Relationship between a mapping and an onto mapping. Figure 38 of [Enderton] p. 145. (Contributed by NM, 10-May-1998.)
blocks.origin:
thm ffoss(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wb(wf(c0, c1, c2), wex(s0, wa(wfo(c0, c1, cv(s0)), wss(cv(s0), c2))))
  -| wcel(c0, universe)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
} = {
  impbii(wf(c0, c1, c2), wex(s0, wa(wfo(c0, c1, cv(s0)), wss(cv(s0), c2))))
  sylbi(wf(c0, c1, c2), wex(s0, wa(wfo(c0, c1, cv(s0)), wss(cv(s0), c2))), wa(wfo(c0, c1, crn(c0)), wss(crn(c0), c2)))
  bitri(wf(c0, c1, c2), wa(wfo(c0, c1, crn(c0)), wss(crn(c0), c2)), wa(wfn(c0, c1), wss(crn(c0), c2)))
  df-f(c0, c1, c2)
  anbi1i(wfn(c0, c1), wss(crn(c0), c2), wfo(c0, c1, crn(c0)))
  dffn4(c0, c1)
  spcev(s0, crn(c0), wa(wfo(c0, c1, crn(c0)), wss(crn(c0), c2)), wa(wfo(c0, c1, cv(s0)), wss(cv(s0), c2)))
  rnex(c0)
  anbi12d(wceq(cv(s0), crn(c0)), wfo(c0, c1, cv(s0)), wss(cv(s0), c2), wfo(c0, c1, crn(c0)), wss(crn(c0), c2))
  foeq3(cv(s0), crn(c0), c0, c1)
  sseq1(cv(s0), crn(c0), c2)
  exlimiv(s0, wa(wfo(c0, c1, cv(s0)), wss(cv(s0), c2)), wf(c0, c1, c2))
  sylan(wfo(c0, c1, cv(s0)), wss(cv(s0), c2), wf(c0, c1, c2), wf(c0, c1, cv(s0)))
  fof(c0, c1, cv(s0))
  fss(c0, c1, cv(s0), c2)
  diff.wa.s(s0, wfo(c0, c1, crn(c0)), wss(crn(c0), c2))
  diff.wfo.s(s0, c0, c1, crn(c0))
  diff.wss.s(s0, crn(c0), c2)
  diff.crn.s(s0, c0)
  diff.wf.s(s0, c0, c1, c2)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm ffoss(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  ⊢ ((c0 : c1 → c2)↔ ∃(s0,((c0 : c1 ↠ s0)∧ s0 ⊆ c2)))
  ⊣ c0 ∈ 𝕌
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c2)
} = {
  impbii((c0 : c1 → c2), ∃(s0,((c0 : c1 ↠ s0)∧ s0 ⊆ c2)))
  sylbi((c0 : c1 → c2), ∃(s0,((c0 : c1 ↠ s0)∧ s0 ⊆ c2)), ((c0 : c1 ↠ ran(c0))∧ ran(c0)⊆ c2))
  bitri((c0 : c1 → c2), ((c0 : c1 ↠ ran(c0))∧ ran(c0)⊆ c2), (c0[Fn]c1 ∧ ran(c0)⊆ c2))
  df-f(c0, c1, c2)
  anbi1i(c0[Fn]c1, ran(c0)⊆ c2, (c0 : c1 ↠ ran(c0)))
  dffn4(c0, c1)
  spcev(s0, ran(c0), ((c0 : c1 ↠ ran(c0))∧ ran(c0)⊆ c2), ((c0 : c1 ↠ s0)∧ s0 ⊆ c2))
  rnex(c0)
  anbi12d(s0 = ran(c0), (c0 : c1 ↠ s0), s0 ⊆ c2, (c0 : c1 ↠ ran(c0)), ran(c0)⊆ c2)
  foeq3(s0, ran(c0), c0, c1)
  sseq1(s0, ran(c0), c2)
  exlimiv(s0, ((c0 : c1 ↠ s0)∧ s0 ⊆ c2), (c0 : c1 → c2))
  sylan((c0 : c1 ↠ s0), s0 ⊆ c2, (c0 : c1 → c2), (c0 : c1 → s0))
  fof(c0, c1, s0)
  fss(c0, c1, s0, c2)
  diff.wa.s(s0, (c0 : c1 ↠ ran(c0)), ran(c0)⊆ c2)
  diff.wfo.s(s0, c0, c1, ran(c0))
  diff.wss.s(s0, ran(c0), c2)
  diff.crn.s(s0, c0)
  diff.wf.s(s0, c0, c1, c2)
}

thm f11o(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wb(wf1(c0, c1, c2), wex(s0, wa(wf1o(c0, c1, cv(s0)), wss(cv(s0), c2))))
  -| wcel(c0, universe)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
} = {
  3bitr4i(wf1(c0, c1, c2), wex(s0, wa(wf1o(c0, c1, cv(s0)), wss(cv(s0), c2))), wa(wf(c0, c1, c2), wfun(ccnv(c0))), wa(wex(s0, wa(wfo(c0, c1, cv(s0)), wss(cv(s0), c2))), wfun(ccnv(c0))))
  anbi1i(wf(c0, c1, c2), wfun(ccnv(c0)), wex(s0, wa(wfo(c0, c1, cv(s0)), wss(cv(s0), c2))))
  ffoss(s0, c0, c1, c2)
  df-f1(c0, c1, c2)
  bitri(wex(s0, wa(wf1o(c0, c1, cv(s0)), wss(cv(s0), c2))), wa(wex(s0, wa(wfo(c0, c1, cv(s0)), wss(cv(s0), c2))), wfun(ccnv(c0))), wex(s0, wa(wa(wfo(c0, c1, cv(s0)), wss(cv(s0), c2)), wfun(ccnv(c0)))))
  exbii(s0, wa(wf1o(c0, c1, cv(s0)), wss(cv(s0), c2)), wa(wa(wfo(c0, c1, cv(s0)), wss(cv(s0), c2)), wfun(ccnv(c0))))
  bitri(wa(wf1o(c0, c1, cv(s0)), wss(cv(s0), c2)), wa(wa(wfo(c0, c1, cv(s0)), wss(cv(s0), c2)), wfun(ccnv(c0))), wa(wa(wfo(c0, c1, cv(s0)), wfun(ccnv(c0))), wss(cv(s0), c2)))
  anbi1i(wf1o(c0, c1, cv(s0)), wss(cv(s0), c2), wa(wfo(c0, c1, cv(s0)), wfun(ccnv(c0))))
  dff1o3(c0, c1, cv(s0))
  an32(wfo(c0, c1, cv(s0)), wfun(ccnv(c0)), wss(cv(s0), c2))
  19.41v(s0, wa(wfo(c0, c1, cv(s0)), wss(cv(s0), c2)), wfun(ccnv(c0)))
  diff.wfun.s(s0, ccnv(c0))
  diff.ccnv.s(s0, c0)
}

thm resfunexgALT(class c0, class c1, class c2) {

  3syl(wa(wfun(c0), wcel(c1, c2)), wcel(cres(c0, c1), universe), wa(wcel(cdm(cres(c0, c1)), universe), wcel(crn(cres(c0, c1)), universe)), wcel(cxp(cdm(cres(c0, c1)), crn(cres(c0, c1))), universe))
  jca(wa(wfun(c0), wcel(c1, c2)), wcel(cdm(cres(c0, c1)), universe), wcel(crn(cres(c0, c1)), universe))
  adantl(wfun(c0), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(cdm(cres(c0, c1)), universe))
  dmresexg(c1, c2, c0)
  syl5eqelr(crn(cres(c0, c1)), universe, cima(c0, c1), wa(wfun(c0), wcel(c1, c2)))
  df-ima(c0, c1)
  funimaexg(c0, c1, c2)
  xpexg(cdm(cres(c0, c1)), universe, crn(cres(c0, c1)), universe)
  mpan(wcel(cxp(cdm(cres(c0, c1)), crn(cres(c0, c1))), universe), wcel(cres(c0, c1), universe), wss(cres(c0, c1), cxp(cdm(cres(c0, c1)), crn(cres(c0, c1)))))
  ax-mp(wss(cres(c0, c1), cxp(cdm(cres(c0, c1)), crn(cres(c0, c1)))), wrel(cres(c0, c1)))
  relres(c0, c1)
  relssdmrn(cres(c0, c1))
  ssexg(cres(c0, c1), cxp(cdm(cres(c0, c1)), crn(cres(c0, c1))), universe)
}

thm resfunexgALT(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  ⊢ ((Fun(c0)∧ c1 ∈ c2)→(c0 |` c1)∈ 𝕌)
} = {
  3syl((Fun(c0)∧ c1 ∈ c2), (c0 |` c1)∈ 𝕌, (dom((c0 |` c1))∈ 𝕌 ∧ ran((c0 |` c1))∈ 𝕌), (dom((c0 |` c1))× ran((c0 |` c1)))∈ 𝕌)
  jca((Fun(c0)∧ c1 ∈ c2), dom((c0 |` c1))∈ 𝕌, ran((c0 |` c1))∈ 𝕌)
  adantl(Fun(c0), c1 ∈ c2, dom((c0 |` c1))∈ 𝕌)
  dmresexg(c1, c2, c0)

  mpan((dom((c0 |` c1))× ran((c0 |` c1)))∈ 𝕌, (c0 |` c1)∈ 𝕌, (c0 |` c1)⊆(dom((c0 |` c1))× ran((c0 |` c1))))
  ax-mp((c0 |` c1)⊆(dom((c0 |` c1))× ran((c0 |` c1))), Rel((c0 |` c1)))

blocks.name: cofunexg
blocks.content: Existence of a composition when the first member is a function. (Contributed by NM, 8-Oct-2007.)
blocks.origin:
thm cofunexg(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wa(wfun(c0), wcel(c1, c2)), wcel(ccom(c0, c1), universe))
} = {
  sylancr(wa(wfun(c0), wcel(c1, c2)), wcel(ccom(c0, c1), universe), wss(ccom(c0, c1), cxp(cdm(ccom(c0, c1)), crn(ccom(c0, c1)))), wcel(cxp(cdm(ccom(c0, c1)), crn(ccom(c0, c1))), universe))
  ax-mp(wss(ccom(c0, c1), cxp(cdm(ccom(c0, c1)), crn(ccom(c0, c1)))), wrel(ccom(c0, c1)))
  relco(c0, c1)
  relssdmrn(ccom(c0, c1))
  xpexd(cdm(ccom(c0, c1)), crn(ccom(c0, c1)), universe, universe, wa(wfun(c0), wcel(c1, c2)))
  adantl(wfun(c0), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(cdm(ccom(c0, c1)), universe))
  sylancr(wcel(c1, c2), wcel(cdm(ccom(c0, c1)), universe), wss(cdm(ccom(c0, c1)), cdm(c1)), wcel(cdm(c1), universe))
  dmcoss(c0, c1)
  dmexg(c1, c2)
  ssexg(cdm(ccom(c0, c1)), cdm(c1), universe)
  syl5eqel(crn(ccom(c0, c1)), universe, crn(cres(c0, crn(c1))), wa(wfun(c0), wcel(c1, c2)))
  rnco(c0, c1)
  syl(wa(wfun(c0), wcel(c1, c2)), wcel(crn(cres(c0, crn(c1))), universe), wcel(cres(c0, crn(c1)), universe))
  sylan2(wfun(c0), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(cres(c0, crn(c1)), universe), wcel(crn(c1), universe))
  rnexg(c1, c2)
  resfunexg(c0, crn(c1), universe)
  rnexg(cres(c0, crn(c1)), universe)
  ssexg(ccom(c0, c1), cxp(cdm(ccom(c0, c1)), crn(ccom(c0, c1))), universe)
}

thm cofunex2g(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wfun(ccnv(c2))), wcel(ccom(c0, c2), universe))
} = {
  ancoms(wcel(c0, c1), wfun(ccnv(c2)), wcel(ccom(c0, c2), universe))
  syl(wa(wfun(ccnv(c2)), wcel(c0, c1)), wcel(ccom(c0, c2), universe), wcel(ccom(ccnv(c2), ccnv(c0)), universe))
  sylan2(wfun(ccnv(c2)), wcel(c0, c1), wcel(ccom(ccnv(c2), ccnv(c0)), universe), wcel(ccnv(c0), universe))
  cnvexg(c0, c1)
  cofunexg(ccnv(c2), ccnv(c0), universe)
  syl5eqel(ccom(c0, c2), universe, ccnv(ccom(ccnv(c2), ccnv(c0))), wcel(ccom(ccnv(c2), ccnv(c0)), universe))
  3eqtrri(ccom(c0, c2), ccnv(ccom(ccnv(c2), ccnv(c0))), ccom(ccnv(ccnv(c0)), ccnv(ccnv(c2))), ccom(ccnv(ccnv(c0)), c2))
  cnvco(ccnv(c2), ccnv(c0))
  cocnvcnv2(ccnv(ccnv(c0)), c2)
  cocnvcnv1(c0, c2)

}

}

blocks.content: Alternate proof of ~ fnex , derived using the Axiom of Replacement in the form of ~ funimaexg . This version uses ~ ax-pow and ~ ax-un , whereas ~ fnex does not. (Contributed by NM, 14-Aug-1994.) (Proof modification is discouraged.) (New usage is discouraged.)

thm fnexALT(class c0, class c1, class c2) {

  biimpar(wfn(c0, c1), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(cdm(c0), c2))

  eleq1d(crn(c0), universe, cima(c0, c1), wfn(c0, c1))

thm fnexALT(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  ⊢ ((c0[Fn]c1 ∧ c1 ∈ c2)→ c0 ∈ 𝕌)
} = {
  syl2anc((c0[Fn]c1 ∧ c1 ∈ c2), c0 ∈ 𝕌, c0 ⊆(dom(c0)× ran(c0)), (dom(c0)× ran(c0))∈ 𝕌)
  adantr(c0[Fn]c1, c1 ∈ c2, c0 ⊆(dom(c0)× ran(c0)))
  syl(c0[Fn]c1, c0 ⊆(dom(c0)× ran(c0)), Rel(c0))
  fnrel(c0, c1)
  relssdmrn(c0)
  syl2anc((c0[Fn]c1 ∧ c1 ∈ c2), (dom(c0)× ran(c0))∈ 𝕌, dom(c0)∈ c2, ran(c0)∈ 𝕌)
  biimpar(c0[Fn]c1, c1 ∈ c2, dom(c0)∈ c2)
  eleq1d(dom(c0), c2, c1, c0[Fn]c1)
  syldan(c0[Fn]c1, c1 ∈ c2, ran(c0)∈ 𝕌, (c0 " c1)∈ 𝕌)
  sylan(c0[Fn]c1, c1 ∈ c2, (c0 " c1)∈ 𝕌, Fun(c0))
  fnfun(c0, c1)
  funimaexg(c0, c1, c2)
  biimpar(c0[Fn]c1, (c0 " c1)∈ 𝕌, ran(c0)∈ 𝕌)
  eleq1d(ran(c0), universe, (c0 " c1), c0[Fn]c1)
  syl5eqr(ran(c0), (c0 " c1), (c0 " dom(c0)), c0[Fn]c1)
  imadmrn(c0)
  imaeq2d(c0, dom(c0), c1, c0[Fn]c1)
  fndm(c0, c1)
  xpexg(dom(c0), c2, ran(c0), universe)
  ssexg(c0, (dom(c0)× ran(c0)), universe)
}

blocks.name: funrnex
blocks.content: If the domain of a function exists, so does its range. Part of Theorem 4.15(v) of [Monk1] p. 46. This theorem is derived using the Axiom of Replacement in the form of ~ funex . (Contributed by NM, 11-Nov-1995.)

blocks.name: zfrep6
blocks.content: A version of the Axiom of Replacement. Normally ` ph ` would have free variables ` x ` and ` y ` . Axiom 6 of [Kunen] p. 12. The Separation Scheme ~ ax-sep cannot be derived from this version and must be stated as a separate axiom in an axiom system (such as Kunen's) that uses this version in place of our ~ ax-rep . (Contributed by NM, 10-Oct-2003.)

blocks.name: fornex
blocks.content: If the domain of an onto function exists, so does its codomain. (Contributed by NM, 23-Jul-2004.)
blocks.origin:
thm fornex(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wi(wfo(c2, c0, c3), wcel(c3, universe)))
} = {
  com12(wcel(c0, c1), wfo(c2, c0, c3), wcel(c3, universe))
  3imtr3d(wfo(c2, c0, c3), wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c3, universe), wcel(cdm(c2), c1), wcel(crn(c2), universe))
  syl5com(wfo(c2, c0, c3), wcel(cdm(c2), c1), wcel(crn(c2), universe), wfun(c2))
  fofun(c2, c0, c3)
  funrnex(c2, c1)
  eleq1d(cdm(c2), c1, c0, wfo(c2, c0, c3))
  fdmd(c2, c0, c3, wfo(c2, c0, c3))
  fof(c2, c0, c3)
  eleq1d(crn(c2), universe, c3, wfo(c2, c0, c3))
  forn(c2, c0, c3)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm fornex(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ c1 →((c2 : c0 ↠ c3)→ c3 ∈ 𝕌))
} = {
  com12(c0 ∈ c1, (c2 : c0 ↠ c3), c3 ∈ 𝕌)
  3imtr3d((c2 : c0 ↠ c3), c0 ∈ c1, c3 ∈ 𝕌, dom(c2)∈ c1, ran(c2)∈ 𝕌)
  syl5com((c2 : c0 ↠ c3), dom(c2)∈ c1, ran(c2)∈ 𝕌, Fun(c2))
  fofun(c2, c0, c3)
  funrnex(c2, c1)
  eleq1d(dom(c2), c1, c0, (c2 : c0 ↠ c3))
  fdmd(c2, c0, c3, (c2 : c0 ↠ c3))
  fof(c2, c0, c3)
  eleq1d(ran(c2), universe, c3, (c2 : c0 ↠ c3))
  forn(c2, c0, c3)
}

blocks.name: f1dmex
blocks.content: If the codomain of a one-to-one function exists, so does its domain. This theorem is equivalent to the Axiom of Replacement ~ ax-rep . (Contributed by NM, 4-Sep-2004.)
blocks.origin:
thm f1dmex(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wa(wf1(c0, c1, c2), wcel(c2, c3)), wcel(c1, universe))
} = {
  imp(wf1(c0, c1, c2), wcel(c2, c3), wcel(c1, universe))
  syl6ci(wf1(c0, c1, c2), wcel(c2, c3), wcel(c1, universe), wcel(crn(c0), universe), wfo(ccnv(c0), crn(c0), c1))
  ex(wf1(c0, c1, c2), wcel(c2, c3), wcel(crn(c0), universe))
  sylan(wf1(c0, c1, c2), wcel(c2, c3), wcel(crn(c0), universe), wss(crn(c0), c2))
  frnd(c0, c2, c1, wf1(c0, c1, c2))
  f1f(c0, c1, c2)
  ssexg(crn(c0), c2, c3)
  syl(wf1(c0, c1, c2), wfo(ccnv(c0), crn(c0), c1), wf1o(ccnv(c0), crn(c0), c1))
  f1cnv(c0, c1, c2)
  f1ofo(ccnv(c0), crn(c0), c1)
  fornex(crn(c0), universe, ccnv(c0), c1)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm f1dmex(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  ⊢ (((c0 : c1 ↣ c2)∧ c2 ∈ c3)→ c1 ∈ 𝕌)
} = {
  imp((c0 : c1 ↣ c2), c2 ∈ c3, c1 ∈ 𝕌)
  syl6ci((c0 : c1 ↣ c2), c2 ∈ c3, c1 ∈ 𝕌, ran(c0)∈ 𝕌, (`' c0 : ran(c0)↠ c1))
  ex((c0 : c1 ↣ c2), c2 ∈ c3, ran(c0)∈ 𝕌)
  sylan((c0 : c1 ↣ c2), c2 ∈ c3, ran(c0)∈ 𝕌, ran(c0)⊆ c2)
  frnd(c0, c2, c1, (c0 : c1 ↣ c2))
  f1f(c0, c1, c2)
  ssexg(ran(c0), c2, c3)
  syl((c0 : c1 ↣ c2), (`' c0 : ran(c0)↠ c1), (`' c0 : ran(c0)↔ c1))
  f1cnv(c0, c1, c2)
  f1ofo(`' c0, ran(c0), c1)
  fornex(ran(c0), universe, `' c0, c1)
}

blocks.name: f1ovv
blocks.content: The range of a 1-1 onto function is a set iff its domain is a set. (Contributed by AV, 21-Mar-2019.)

blocks.name: fvclex
blocks.content: Existence of the class of values of a set. (Contributed by NM, 9-Nov-1995.)

blocks.name: fvresex
blocks.content: Existence of the class of values of a restricted class. (Contributed by NM, 14-Nov-1995.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 11-Sep-2015.)

thm fvresex(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1) {

  -| wcel(c1, universe)

  -| diffsc(s0, c0)

  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
} = {
  eqeltrri(cab(s0, wex(s1, wceq(cv(s0), cfv(cres(c0, c1), cv(s1))))), universe, cab(s0, wex(s1, wceq(cv(s0), cfv(cmpt(hs0, c1, cfv(c0, cv(hs0))), cv(s1))))))
  abbii(s0, wex(s1, wceq(cv(s0), cfv(cmpt(hs0, c1, cfv(c0, cv(hs0))), cv(s1)))), wex(s1, wceq(cv(s0), cfv(cres(c0, c1), cv(s1)))))
  exbii(s1, wceq(cv(s0), cfv(cmpt(hs0, c1, cfv(c0, cv(hs0))), cv(s1))), wceq(cv(s0), cfv(cres(c0, c1), cv(s1))))
  eqeq2i(cv(s0), cfv(cmpt(hs0, c1, cfv(c0, cv(hs0))), cv(s1)), cfv(cres(c0, c1), cv(s1)))
  eqtr3i(cfv(cmpt(hs0, c1, cfv(c0, cv(hs0))), cv(s1)), cfv(cres(c0, c1), cv(s1)), cfv(cres(cmpt(hs0, universe, cfv(c0, cv(hs0))), c1), cv(s1)))
  fveq1i(cres(cmpt(hs0, universe, cfv(c0, cv(hs0))), c1), cv(s1), cmpt(hs0, c1, cfv(c0, cv(hs0))))
  ax-mp(wceq(cres(cmpt(hs0, universe, cfv(c0, cv(hs0))), c1), cmpt(hs0, c1, cfv(c0, cv(hs0)))), wss(c1, universe))
  ssv(c1)
  resmpt(hs0, c1, universe, cfv(c0, cv(hs0)))
  ax-mp(wceq(cfv(cres(cmpt(hs0, universe, cfv(c0, cv(hs0))), c1), cv(s1)), cfv(cres(c0, c1), cv(s1))), wceq(cfv(cmpt(hs0, universe, cfv(c0, cv(hs0))), cv(s1)), cfv(c0, cv(s1))))
  elv(s1, wceq(cfv(cmpt(hs0, universe, cfv(c0, cv(hs0))), cv(s1)), cfv(c0, cv(s1))))
  fvmpt(hs0, cv(s1), universe, cmpt(hs0, universe, cfv(c0, cv(hs0))), cfv(c0, cv(s1)), cfv(c0, cv(hs0)))
  fveq2(cv(hs0), cv(s1), c0)
  eqid(cmpt(hs0, universe, cfv(c0, cv(hs0))))
  fvex(c0, cv(s1))
  fveqres(cmpt(hs0, universe, cfv(c0, cv(hs0))), cv(s1), c0, c1)
  fvclex(s0, s1, cmpt(hs0, c1, cfv(c0, cv(hs0))))
  mptex(hs0, c1, cfv(c0, cv(hs0)))
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(universe)
  diff.hs0.c(cv(s1))
  diff.hs0.c(cfv(c0, cv(s1)))
  diff.cmpt.s(s0, hs0, c1, cfv(c0, cv(hs0)))
  diff.cfv.s(s0, c0, cv(hs0))
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.cmpt.s(s1, hs0, c1, cfv(c0, cv(hs0)))
  diff.cfv.s(s1, c0, cv(hs0))
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm fvresex(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ { s0 | ∃(s1, s0 =((c0 |` c1)` s1))} ∈ 𝕌
  ⊣ c1 ∈ 𝕌
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c1)
  ⊣ d(s1, c0)
  ⊣ d(s1, c1)
} = {
  eqeltrri({ s0 | ∃(s1, s0 =((c0 |` c1)` s1))}, universe, { s0 | ∃(s1, s0 =((hs0 ∈ c1 ↦(c0 ` hs0))` s1))})
  abbii(s0, ∃(s1, s0 =((hs0 ∈ c1 ↦(c0 ` hs0))` s1)), ∃(s1, s0 =((c0 |` c1)` s1)))
  exbii(s1, s0 =((hs0 ∈ c1 ↦(c0 ` hs0))` s1), s0 =((c0 |` c1)` s1))
  eqeq2i(s0, ((hs0 ∈ c1 ↦(c0 ` hs0))` s1), ((c0 |` c1)` s1))
  eqtr3i(((hs0 ∈ c1 ↦(c0 ` hs0))` s1), ((c0 |` c1)` s1), (((hs0 ∈ 𝕌 ↦(c0 ` hs0))|` c1)` s1))
  fveq1i(((hs0 ∈ 𝕌 ↦(c0 ` hs0))|` c1), s1, (hs0 ∈ c1 ↦(c0 ` hs0)))
  ax-mp(((hs0 ∈ 𝕌 ↦(c0 ` hs0))|` c1)=(hs0 ∈ c1 ↦(c0 ` hs0)), c1 ⊆ 𝕌)
  ssv(c1)
  resmpt(hs0, c1, universe, (c0 ` hs0))
  ax-mp((((hs0 ∈ 𝕌 ↦(c0 ` hs0))|` c1)` s1)=((c0 |` c1)` s1), ((hs0 ∈ 𝕌 ↦(c0 ` hs0))` s1)=(c0 ` s1))
  elv(s1, ((hs0 ∈ 𝕌 ↦(c0 ` hs0))` s1)=(c0 ` s1))
  fvmpt(hs0, s1, universe, (hs0 ∈ 𝕌 ↦(c0 ` hs0)), (c0 ` s1), (c0 ` hs0))
  fveq2(hs0, s1, c0)
  eqid((hs0 ∈ 𝕌 ↦(c0 ` hs0)))
  fvex(c0, s1)
  fveqres((hs0 ∈ 𝕌 ↦(c0 ` hs0)), s1, c0, c1)
  fvclex(s0, s1, (hs0 ∈ c1 ↦(c0 ` hs0)))
  mptex(hs0, c1, (c0 ` hs0))
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(universe)
  diff.hs0.c(s1)
  diff.hs0.c((c0 ` s1))
  diff.cmpt.s(s0, hs0, c1, (c0 ` hs0))
  diff.cfv.s(s0, c0, hs0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.cmpt.s(s1, hs0, c1, (c0 ` hs0))
  diff.cfv.s(s1, c0, hs0)
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
}

blocks.name: abrexexg
blocks.content: Existence of a class abstraction of existentially restricted sets. The class ` B ` can be thought of as an expression in ` x ` (which is typically a free variable in the class expression substituted for ` B ` ) and the class abstraction appearing in the statement as the class of values ` B ` as ` x ` varies through ` A ` . If the "domain" ` A ` is a set, then the abstraction is also a set. Therefore, this statement is a kind of Replacement. This can be seen by tracing back through the path ~ mptexg , ~ funex , ~ fnex , ~ resfunexg , and ~ funimaexg . See also ~ abrexex2g . There are partial converses under additional conditions, see for instance ~ abnexg . (Contributed by NM, 3-Nov-2003.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 31-Aug-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm abrexexg(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(cab(s0, wrex(s1, c0, wceq(cv(s0), c2))), universe))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
} = {
  syl5eqelr(cab(s0, wrex(s1, c0, wceq(cv(s0), c2))), universe, crn(cmpt(s1, c0, c2)), wcel(c0, c1))
  rnmpt(s0, s1, cmpt(s1, c0, c2), c0, c2)
  eqid(cmpt(s1, c0, c2))
  syl(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(crn(cmpt(s1, c0, c2)), universe), wcel(cmpt(s1, c0, c2), universe))
  mptexg(s1, c0, c1, c2)
  rnexg(cmpt(s1, c0, c2), universe)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm abrexexg(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ c1 → { s0 | ∃(s1 ∈ c0, s0 = c2)} ∈ 𝕌)
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c2)
  ⊣ d(s1, c0)
} = {
  syl5eqelr({ s0 | ∃(s1 ∈ c0, s0 = c2)}, universe, ran((s1 ∈ c0 ↦ c2)), c0 ∈ c1)
  rnmpt(s0, s1, (s1 ∈ c0 ↦ c2), c0, c2)
  eqid((s1 ∈ c0 ↦ c2))
  syl(c0 ∈ c1, ran((s1 ∈ c0 ↦ c2))∈ 𝕌, (s1 ∈ c0 ↦ c2)∈ 𝕌)
  mptexg(s1, c0, c1, c2)
  rnexg((s1 ∈ c0 ↦ c2), universe)
}

blocks.name: abrexex
blocks.content: Existence of a class abstraction of existentially restricted sets. See the comment of ~ abrexexg . See also ~ abrexex2 . (Contributed by NM, 16-Oct-2003.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 31-Aug-2015.)

blocks.name: iunexg
blocks.content: The existence of an indexed union. ` x ` is normally a free-variable parameter in ` B ` . (Contributed by NM, 23-Mar-2006.)
blocks.origin:
thm iunexg(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wral(s0, c0, wcel(c2, c3))), wcel(ciun(s0, c0, c2), universe))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
} = {
  eqeltrd(ciun(s0, c0, c2), universe, cuni(cab(hs0, wrex(s0, c0, wceq(cv(hs0), c2)))), wa(wcel(c0, c1), wral(s0, c0, wcel(c2, c3))))
  adantl(wcel(c0, c1), wral(s0, c0, wcel(c2, c3)), wceq(ciun(s0, c0, c2), cuni(cab(hs0, wrex(s0, c0, wceq(cv(hs0), c2))))))
  dfiun2g(s0, hs0, c0, c2, c3)
  adantr(wcel(c0, c1), wral(s0, c0, wcel(c2, c3)), wcel(cuni(cab(hs0, wrex(s0, c0, wceq(cv(hs0), c2)))), universe))
  syl(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(cuni(cab(hs0, wrex(s0, c0, wceq(cv(hs0), c2)))), universe), wcel(cab(hs0, wrex(s0, c0, wceq(cv(hs0), c2))), universe))
  abrexexg(hs0, s0, c0, c1, c2)
  uniexg(cab(hs0, wrex(s0, c0, wceq(cv(hs0), c2))), universe)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm iunexg(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ c1 ∧ ∀(s0 ∈ c0, c2 ∈ c3))→ ⋃(s0 ∈ c0, c2)∈ 𝕌)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
} = {
  eqeltrd(⋃(s0 ∈ c0, c2), universe, ⋃ { hs0 | ∃(s0 ∈ c0, hs0 = c2)}, (c0 ∈ c1 ∧ ∀(s0 ∈ c0, c2 ∈ c3)))
  adantl(c0 ∈ c1, ∀(s0 ∈ c0, c2 ∈ c3), ⋃(s0 ∈ c0, c2)= ⋃ { hs0 | ∃(s0 ∈ c0, hs0 = c2)})
  dfiun2g(s0, hs0, c0, c2, c3)
  adantr(c0 ∈ c1, ∀(s0 ∈ c0, c2 ∈ c3), ⋃ { hs0 | ∃(s0 ∈ c0, hs0 = c2)} ∈ 𝕌)
  syl(c0 ∈ c1, ⋃ { hs0 | ∃(s0 ∈ c0, hs0 = c2)} ∈ 𝕌, { hs0 | ∃(s0 ∈ c0, hs0 = c2)} ∈ 𝕌)
  abrexexg(hs0, s0, c0, c1, c2)
  uniexg({ hs0 | ∃(s0 ∈ c0, hs0 = c2)}, universe)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: abrexex2g
blocks.content: Existence of an existentially restricted class abstraction. (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 2-Sep-2009.)
blocks.origin:
thm abrexex2g(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wral(s0, c0, wcel(cab(s1, w0), c2))), wcel(cab(s1, wrex(s0, c0, w0)), universe))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
} = {
  a1ii(wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wral(s0, c0, wcel(cab(s1, w0), c2))), wcel(cab(s1, wrex(s0, c0, w0)), universe)), diffsc(s0, c1))
  a1ii(wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wral(s0, c0, wcel(cab(s1, w0), c2))), wcel(cab(s1, wrex(s0, c0, w0)), universe)), diffsc(s0, c2))
  a1ii(wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wral(s0, c0, wcel(cab(s1, w0), c2))), wcel(cab(s1, wrex(s0, c0, w0)), universe)), diffsc(s1, c1))
  a1ii(wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wral(s0, c0, wcel(cab(s1, w0), c2))), wcel(cab(s1, wrex(s0, c0, w0)), universe)), diffsc(s1, c2))
  syl5eqel(cab(s1, wrex(s0, c0, w0)), universe, cab(hs0, wrex(s0, c0, wcel(cv(hs0), cab(s1, w0)))), wa(wcel(c0, c1), wral(s0, c0, wcel(cab(s1, w0), c2))))
  eqtr4i(cab(s1, wrex(s0, c0, w0)), cab(hs0, wrex(s0, c0, wcel(cv(hs0), cab(s1, w0)))), cab(hs0, wrex(s0, c0, wsb(hs0, s1, w0))))
  cbvab(s1, hs0, wrex(s0, c0, w0), wrex(s0, c0, wsb(hs0, s1, w0)))
  nfv(hs0, wrex(s0, c0, w0))
  nfrex(s1, s0, c0, wsb(hs0, s1, w0))
  nfcv(s1, c0)
  nfs1v(s1, hs0, w0)
  rexbidv(s0, c0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(hs0)), w0, wsb(hs0, s1, w0))
  sbequ12(s1, hs0, w0)
  abbii(hs0, wrex(s0, c0, wcel(cv(hs0), cab(s1, w0))), wrex(s0, c0, wsb(hs0, s1, w0)))
  rexbii(s0, c0, wcel(cv(hs0), cab(s1, w0)), wsb(hs0, s1, w0))
  df-clab(hs0, s1, w0)
  syl5eqelr(cab(hs0, wrex(s0, c0, wcel(cv(hs0), cab(s1, w0)))), universe, ciun(s0, c0, cab(s1, w0)), wa(wcel(c0, c1), wral(s0, c0, wcel(cab(s1, w0), c2))))
  df-iun(s0, hs0, c0, cab(s1, w0))
  iunexg(s0, c0, c1, cab(s1, w0), c2)
  diff.hs0.w(wrex(s0, c0, w0))
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diff.wceq.s(s0, cv(s1), cv(hs0))
  diff.cv.s(s0, s1)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cab(s1, w0))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm abrexex2g(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ c1 ∧ ∀(s0 ∈ c0, { s1 | w0 } ∈ c2))→ { s1 | ∃(s0 ∈ c0, w0)} ∈ 𝕌)
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c2)
  ⊣ d(s1, c0)
  ⊣ d(s1, c1)
  ⊣ d(s1, c2)
} = {
  a1ii(((c0 ∈ c1 ∧ ∀(s0 ∈ c0, { s1 | w0 } ∈ c2))→ { s1 | ∃(s0 ∈ c0, w0)} ∈ 𝕌), d(s0, c1))
  a1ii(((c0 ∈ c1 ∧ ∀(s0 ∈ c0, { s1 | w0 } ∈ c2))→ { s1 | ∃(s0 ∈ c0, w0)} ∈ 𝕌), d(s0, c2))
  a1ii(((c0 ∈ c1 ∧ ∀(s0 ∈ c0, { s1 | w0 } ∈ c2))→ { s1 | ∃(s0 ∈ c0, w0)} ∈ 𝕌), d(s1, c1))
  a1ii(((c0 ∈ c1 ∧ ∀(s0 ∈ c0, { s1 | w0 } ∈ c2))→ { s1 | ∃(s0 ∈ c0, w0)} ∈ 𝕌), d(s1, c2))
  syl5eqel({ s1 | ∃(s0 ∈ c0, w0)}, universe, { hs0 | ∃(s0 ∈ c0, hs0 ∈ { s1 | w0 })}, (c0 ∈ c1 ∧ ∀(s0 ∈ c0, { s1 | w0 } ∈ c2)))
  eqtr4i({ s1 | ∃(s0 ∈ c0, w0)}, { hs0 | ∃(s0 ∈ c0, hs0 ∈ { s1 | w0 })}, { hs0 | ∃(s0 ∈ c0,[hs0 / s1]w0)})
  cbvab(s1, hs0, ∃(s0 ∈ c0, w0), ∃(s0 ∈ c0,[hs0 / s1]w0))
  nfv(hs0, ∃(s0 ∈ c0, w0))
  nfrex(s1, s0, c0, [hs0 / s1]w0)
  nfcv(s1, c0)
  nfs1v(s1, hs0, w0)
  rexbidv(s0, c0, s1 = hs0, w0, [hs0 / s1]w0)
  sbequ12(s1, hs0, w0)
  abbii(hs0, ∃(s0 ∈ c0, hs0 ∈ { s1 | w0 }), ∃(s0 ∈ c0,[hs0 / s1]w0))
  rexbii(s0, c0, hs0 ∈ { s1 | w0 }, [hs0 / s1]w0)
  df-clab(hs0, s1, w0)
  syl5eqelr({ hs0 | ∃(s0 ∈ c0, hs0 ∈ { s1 | w0 })}, universe, ⋃(s0 ∈ c0, { s1 | w0 }), (c0 ∈ c1 ∧ ∀(s0 ∈ c0, { s1 | w0 } ∈ c2)))
  df-iun(s0, hs0, c0, { s1 | w0 })
  iunexg(s0, c0, c1, { s1 | w0 }, c2)
  diff.hs0.w(∃(s0 ∈ c0, w0))
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diff.wceq.s(s0, s1, hs0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, s1)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c({ s1 | w0 })
}

blocks.name: opabex3d
blocks.content: Existence of an ordered pair abstraction, deduction version. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 19-Oct-2017.)
blocks.origin:
thm opabex3d(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, wff w0, wff w1) {
  |- wi(w0, wcel(copab(s0, s1, wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), w1)), universe))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, universe))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wcel(cab(s1, w1), universe))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
} = {
  syl5eqelr(copab(s0, s1, wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), w1)), universe, ciun(s0, c0, cxp(csn(cv(s0)), cab(s1, w1))), w0)
  eqriv(hs0, ciun(s0, c0, cxp(csn(cv(s0)), cab(s1, w1))), copab(s0, s1, wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), w1)))
  3bitr4i(wcel(cv(hs0), ciun(s0, c0, cxp(csn(cv(s0)), cab(s1, w1)))), wcel(cv(hs0), copab(s0, s1, wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), w1))), wex(s0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(cv(hs0), cxp(csn(cv(s0)), cab(s1, w1))))), wex(s0, wex(s1, wa(wceq(cv(hs0), cop(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), w1)))))
  exbii(s0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(cv(hs0), cxp(csn(cv(s0)), cab(s1, w1)))), wex(s1, wa(wceq(cv(hs0), cop(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), w1))))
  3bitr4ri(wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(cv(hs0), cxp(csn(cv(s0)), cab(s1, w1)))), wex(s1, wa(wceq(cv(hs0), cop(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), w1))), wex(s1, wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wa(wceq(cv(hs0), cop(cv(s0), cv(s1))), w1))), wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wex(s1, wa(wceq(cv(hs0), cop(cv(s0), cv(s1))), w1))))
  19.42v(s1, wcel(cv(s0), c0), wa(wceq(cv(hs0), cop(cv(s0), cv(s1))), w1))
  exbii(s1, wa(wceq(cv(hs0), cop(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), w1)), wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wa(wceq(cv(hs0), cop(cv(s0), cv(s1))), w1)))
  an12(wceq(cv(hs0), cop(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wcel(cv(s0), c0), w1)
  anbi2i(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(cv(hs0), cxp(csn(cv(s0)), cab(s1, w1))), wex(s1, wa(wceq(cv(hs0), cop(cv(s0), cv(s1))), w1)))
  3bitri(wcel(cv(hs0), cxp(csn(cv(s0)), cab(s1, w1))), wex(s1, wa(wceq(cv(hs0), cop(cv(s0), cv(s1))), w1)), wex(hs1, wex(hs2, wa(wceq(cv(hs0), cop(cv(hs1), cv(hs2))), wa(wcel(cv(hs1), csn(cv(s0))), wcel(cv(hs2), cab(s1, w1)))))), wex(hs2, wa(wceq(cv(hs0), cop(cv(s0), cv(hs2))), wcel(cv(hs2), cab(s1, w1)))))
  elxp(hs1, hs2, cv(hs0), csn(cv(s0)), cab(s1, w1))
  bitri(wex(hs1, wex(hs2, wa(wceq(cv(hs0), cop(cv(hs1), cv(hs2))), wa(wcel(cv(hs1), csn(cv(s0))), wcel(cv(hs2), cab(s1, w1)))))), wex(hs2, wa(wceq(cv(hs0), cop(cv(s0), cv(hs2))), wcel(cv(hs2), cab(s1, w1)))), wex(hs2, wex(hs1, wa(wceq(cv(hs0), cop(cv(hs1), cv(hs2))), wa(wcel(cv(hs1), csn(cv(s0))), wcel(cv(hs2), cab(s1, w1)))))))
  excom(hs1, hs2, wa(wceq(cv(hs0), cop(cv(hs1), cv(hs2))), wa(wcel(cv(hs1), csn(cv(s0))), wcel(cv(hs2), cab(s1, w1)))))
  exbii(hs2, wex(hs1, wa(wceq(cv(hs0), cop(cv(hs1), cv(hs2))), wa(wcel(cv(hs1), csn(cv(s0))), wcel(cv(hs2), cab(s1, w1))))), wa(wceq(cv(hs0), cop(cv(s0), cv(hs2))), wcel(cv(hs2), cab(s1, w1))))
  bitri(wex(hs1, wa(wceq(cv(hs0), cop(cv(hs1), cv(hs2))), wa(wcel(cv(hs1), csn(cv(s0))), wcel(cv(hs2), cab(s1, w1))))), wa(wceq(cv(hs0), cop(cv(s0), cv(hs2))), wcel(cv(hs2), cab(s1, w1))), wex(hs1, wa(wceq(cv(hs1), cv(s0)), wa(wceq(cv(hs0), cop(cv(hs1), cv(hs2))), wcel(cv(hs2), cab(s1, w1))))))
  exbii(hs1, wa(wceq(cv(hs0), cop(cv(hs1), cv(hs2))), wa(wcel(cv(hs1), csn(cv(s0))), wcel(cv(hs2), cab(s1, w1)))), wa(wceq(cv(hs1), cv(s0)), wa(wceq(cv(hs0), cop(cv(hs1), cv(hs2))), wcel(cv(hs2), cab(s1, w1)))))
  bitri(wa(wceq(cv(hs0), cop(cv(hs1), cv(hs2))), wa(wcel(cv(hs1), csn(cv(s0))), wcel(cv(hs2), cab(s1, w1)))), wa(wceq(cv(hs1), cv(s0)), wa(wceq(cv(hs0), cop(cv(hs1), cv(hs2))), wcel(cv(hs2), cab(s1, w1)))), wa(wcel(cv(hs1), csn(cv(s0))), wa(wceq(cv(hs0), cop(cv(hs1), cv(hs2))), wcel(cv(hs2), cab(s1, w1)))))
  an12(wceq(cv(hs0), cop(cv(hs1), cv(hs2))), wcel(cv(hs1), csn(cv(s0))), wcel(cv(hs2), cab(s1, w1)))
  anbi1i(wcel(cv(hs1), csn(cv(s0))), wa(wceq(cv(hs0), cop(cv(hs1), cv(hs2))), wcel(cv(hs2), cab(s1, w1))), wceq(cv(hs1), cv(s0)))

  bitri(∃(hs1,(hs0 = < hs1, hs2 > ∧(hs1 ∈ { s0 } ∧ hs2 ∈ { s1 | w1 }))), (hs0 = < s0, hs2 > ∧ hs2 ∈ { s1 | w1 }), ∃(hs1,(hs1 = s0 ∧(hs0 = < hs1, hs2 > ∧ hs2 ∈ { s1 | w1 }))))
  exbii(hs1, (hs0 = < hs1, hs2 > ∧(hs1 ∈ { s0 } ∧ hs2 ∈ { s1 | w1 })), (hs1 = s0 ∧(hs0 = < hs1, hs2 > ∧ hs2 ∈ { s1 | w1 })))
  bitri((hs0 = < hs1, hs2 > ∧(hs1 ∈ { s0 } ∧ hs2 ∈ { s1 | w1 })), (hs1 = s0 ∧(hs0 = < hs1, hs2 > ∧ hs2 ∈ { s1 | w1 })), (hs1 ∈ { s0 } ∧(hs0 = < hs1, hs2 > ∧ hs2 ∈ { s1 | w1 })))

blocks.name: iunex
blocks.content: The existence of an indexed union. ` x ` is normally a free-variable parameter in the class expression substituted for ` B ` , which can be read informally as ` B ( x ) ` . (Contributed by NM, 13-Oct-2003.)

blocks.name: abrexex2
blocks.content: Existence of an existentially restricted class abstraction. ` ph ` normally has free-variable parameters ` x ` and ` y ` . See also ~ abrexex . (Contributed by NM, 12-Sep-2004.)
blocks.origin:
thm abrexex2(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, wff w0) {
  |- wcel(cab(s0, wrex(s1, c0, w0)), universe)
  -| wcel(c0, universe)
  -| wcel(cab(s0, w0), universe)
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
} = {
  mp2an(wcel(cab(s0, wrex(s1, c0, w0)), universe), wcel(c0, universe), wral(s1, c0, wcel(cab(s0, w0), universe)))
  rgenw(s1, c0, wcel(cab(s0, w0), universe))
  abrexex2g(s1, s0, c0, universe, universe, w0)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
  diff.universe.s(s1)
  diff.universe.s(s0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm abrexex2(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, wff w0) {
  ⊢ { s0 | ∃(s1 ∈ c0, w0)} ∈ 𝕌
  ⊣ c0 ∈ 𝕌
  ⊣ { s0 | w0 } ∈ 𝕌
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s1, c0)
} = {
  mp2an({ s0 | ∃(s1 ∈ c0, w0)} ∈ 𝕌, c0 ∈ 𝕌, ∀(s1 ∈ c0, { s0 | w0 } ∈ 𝕌))
  rgenw(s1, c0, { s0 | w0 } ∈ 𝕌)
  abrexex2g(s1, s0, c0, universe, universe, w0)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
  diff.universe.s(s1)
  diff.universe.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: abexssex
blocks.content: Existence of a class abstraction with an existentially quantified expression. Both ` x ` and ` y ` can be free in ` ph ` . (Contributed by NM, 29-Jul-2006.)

thm abexssex(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, wff w0) {
  |- wcel(cab(s0, wex(s1, wa(wss(cv(s1), c0), w0))), universe)
  -| wcel(c0, universe)

  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
} = {
  eqeltrri(cab(s0, wex(s1, wa(wss(cv(s1), c0), w0))), universe, cab(s0, wrex(s1, cpw(c0), w0)))
  abbii(s0, wrex(s1, cpw(c0), w0), wex(s1, wa(wss(cv(s1), c0), w0)))

thm abexssex(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, wff w0) {
  ⊢ { s0 | ∃(s1,(s1 ⊆ c0 ∧ w0))} ∈ 𝕌
  ⊣ c0 ∈ 𝕌

blocks.name: abexex
blocks.content: A condition where a class builder continues to exist after its wff is existentially quantified. (Contributed by NM, 4-Mar-2007.)
blocks.origin:
thm abexex(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, wff w0) {
  |- wcel(cab(s0, wex(s1, w0)), universe)
  -| wcel(c0, universe)
  -| wi(w0, wcel(cv(s1), c0))
  -| wcel(cab(s0, w0), universe)
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
} = {
  eqeltrri(cab(s0, wex(s1, w0)), universe, cab(s0, wrex(s1, c0, w0)))
  abbii(s0, wrex(s1, c0, w0), wex(s1, w0))
  bitr4i(wrex(s1, c0, w0), wex(s1, w0), wex(s1, wa(wcel(cv(s1), c0), w0)))
  df-rex(s1, c0, w0)
  exbii(s1, w0, wa(wcel(cv(s1), c0), w0))
  pm4.71ri(w0, wcel(cv(s1), c0))
  abrexex2(s0, s1, c0, w0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm abexex(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, wff w0) {
  ⊢ { s0 | ∃(s1, w0)} ∈ 𝕌
  ⊣ c0 ∈ 𝕌
  ⊣ (w0 → s1 ∈ c0)
  ⊣ { s0 | w0 } ∈ 𝕌
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s1, c0)
} = {
  eqeltrri({ s0 | ∃(s1, w0)}, universe, { s0 | ∃(s1 ∈ c0, w0)})
  abbii(s0, ∃(s1 ∈ c0, w0), ∃(s1, w0))
  bitr4i(∃(s1 ∈ c0, w0), ∃(s1, w0), ∃(s1,(s1 ∈ c0 ∧ w0)))
  df-rex(s1, c0, w0)
  exbii(s1, w0, (s1 ∈ c0 ∧ w0))
  pm4.71ri(w0, s1 ∈ c0)

  jca(wa(wwe(c0, c1), wa(wiso(cv(s0), c0, c2, c1, c3), wiso(cv(hs0), c0, c2, c1, c3))), wwe(c0, c1), wse(c0, c1))
  simpl(wwe(c0, c1), wa(wiso(cv(s0), c0, c2, c1, c3), wiso(cv(hs0), c0, c2, c1, c3)))
  syl(wa(wwe(c0, c1), wa(wiso(cv(s0), c0, c2, c1, c3), wiso(cv(hs0), c0, c2, c1, c3))), wse(c0, c1), wcel(c1, universe))
  ad2antrl(wwe(c0, c1), wiso(cv(s0), c0, c2, c1, c3), wiso(cv(hs0), c0, c2, c1, c3), wcel(c1, universe))

  mo4(s0, hs0, wiso(cv(s0), c0, c2, c1, c3), wiso(cv(hs0), c0, c2, c1, c3))
  isoeq1(cv(s0), cv(hs0), c0, c2, c1, c3)
  diff.wwe.s(s0, c0, c1)
  diff.hs0.w(wwe(c0, c1))
  diff.wiso.s(s0, cv(hs0), c0, c2, c1, c3)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)

  syl((c0 ≤ c1 ∧((s0 ≅ c0, c2(c1, c3))∧(hs0 ≅ c0, c2(c1, c3)))), c0[Se]c1, c1 ∈ 𝕌)
  ad2antrl(c0 ≤ c1, (s0 ≅ c0, c2(c1, c3)), (hs0 ≅ c0, c2(c1, c3)), c1 ∈ 𝕌)
  sylancr((s0 ≅ c0, c2(c1, c3)), c1 ∈ 𝕌, s0 ∈ 𝕌, (s0 : c1 → c3))

  syl((s0 ≅ c0, c2(c1, c3)), (s0 : c1 → c3), (s0 : c1 ↔ c3))
  isof1o(s0, c0, c2, c1, c3)
